programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Len and Linda find a seven-year-old girl on the steps of the hospital and Tom makes it his mission to discover where she comes from. Jean acquires a collection of stuffed animals for her scrapyard, and Alec threatens to have the Rev Brewer excommunicated when an exorcism gives the boisterous farmer a heart attack. James Bolam and Michael French star as the father-and-son GPs in the sleepy Lancashire village of Ormston during the 1950s

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Michael is convinced a monster is lurking in the local reservoir and persuades Eddie to try to capture the creature, and Deborah's mother arrives in Ormston unannounced. Back at the surgery, Tom is baffled when Mr Boynton comes in with a bad cough and discovers pigeons might be to blame. Medical drama, starring James Bolam and Michael French, with a guest appearance by Gwen Taylor

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Dangerous Davies has a difficult task on his hands when he investigates the murder of ex-soldier Frank Moore. With members of the dead man's artillery regiment unwilling to break confidences and offer any information, the eccentric detective struggles to gather enough evidence to solve the case. Police drama, guest starring Lindsey Coulson, Hugo Speer and Charles Dale, with Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Investigating the death of Teddy O'Connor, a singer from the 1970s, plunges Davies into the world of rock 'n' roll, where he discovers bitter band rivalry and management disputes could provide a motive for murder. Meanwhile, Aspinall is devastated to learn he is being taken advantage of at work and finds himself returning to old habits. Drama, guest starring Tony Slattery, Philip Middlemiss, Nigel Planer and Tim Healy

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry Crabbe takes on a group of conservationists who are opposed to the building of a new motorway link. Culinary drama, starring Richard Griffiths

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe tracks down a peeping Tom who has taken to stealing underwear, all the while growing more concerned about the direction his enquiries are taking. Culinary crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed, Malcolm Sinclair and Edward Atterton

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe discovers a customer's body in the men's toilet, and its subsequent disappearance makes great demands on his ingenuity. Light-hearted crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed and Bella Enahoro

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently are called in to investigate the death of a miner, which is being treated as suspicious because even though his body was discovered down the pit, records show he was above ground when he disappeared. Alleged victim Arthur Hawkes was a proud union man, and his children confirm he fought long and hard to keep the closure-threatened mine open. But as the detectives dig deeper, they find that not everyone agrees with this portrait of him. Could he really have sold his union comrades down the river? Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Simon Greenall, Jack Deam and Michael Socha

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Shepherd is called upon to investigate when a rugby coach's body is found stripped naked and tied to a goal post. His team's losing streak of 50 straight games has broken national records, and Shepherd is perplexed by a sense of relief in the community. Starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A new musical director for the bell-ringers of St Mary's leads to discord, disharmony and the blood-curdling sound of murder. Mystery, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: Helen finds herself in more danger as the investigation pulls her further into Manchester's criminal underworld. Paranoid, vulnerable but unperturbed, she tracks down the gang responsible for the shooting - before the case throws up some shocking revelations. And can Theo cheat death as the gang continues to be hunted by a mystery gunman?

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The Edinburgh detective investigates the murder of notorious gangster Morris Cafferty's illegitimate son, as the search goes on to find the person who put Sammy in a life-threatening coma. The hunt for the killer is complicated by apparent links to a spate of hate crimes by racist extremists in the city centre. Gritty crime thriller, starring John Hannah and James Cosmo

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A homeless man opens an abandoned suitcase in a park, only to find the body of a teenage girl inside. Jack and Nikki attend the scene with DS Sally Kirchner and are shocked to discover the victim's baby has been cut from her womb. From the placenta they are able to identify the father - but the married man in question denies any knowledge of the deceased. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star in the forensic crime drama, with guest appearances by Morven Christie and Sean Gallagher

programme.title: The Line of Beauty
programme.desc: Drama, adapted from Alan Hollinghurst's 2004 Man Booker Prize-winning novel. Set in the 1980s, the plot focuses on the exploits of a middle-class homosexual man, who goes to live at the house of a newly elected Conservative MP. Dan Stevens and Tim McInnerny star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Newcomer PC Honey Harman arrives at Sun Hill, where she receives a warm welcome from a smitten PC Gary Best. Rape witness Beth Tyler arouses the fury of local mothers and Nathan Morley suddenly finds himself the prime suspect in a murder inquiry, while conscience-stricken copper Reg Hollis agonises over whether to tell Acting DI Sam Nixon what he saw her daughter getting up to with unlikely Romeo Sgt Matt Boyden

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Polly Page returns to Sun Hill and finds herself assigned to the CSU department, where she spends her first day with the manipulative and increasingly unpleasant PC Cathy Bradford, whose abrasive personality contrasts sharply with her own good nature. PC Gary Best goes undercover in a bid to nab drug-dealers plying their trade at a local school, and PC Jim Carver is assigned to look after a woman whose daughter has been killed, while Acting DI Sam Nixon is furious to learn her 15-year-old daughter Abi doesn't want any charges brought against Sergeant Matt Boyden

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Des Taviner is given his own set of wheels and proudly hits the road in a new capacity _ ward officer. DC Danny Glaze suffers the indignity of being transferred to the Community Safety Unit, while Sergeant Matt Boyden confronts a gunman and later finds himself forced to work alongside Acting DI Sam Nixon _ who doesn't take kindly to being partnered with the middle-aged Lothario responsible for taking advantage of her daughter. Paul Usher and Lisa Maxwell star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Des Taviner enlists a Chinese Catholic priest to help him solve a mystery, and volatile witness Beth jeopardises the outcome of the rape trial. Meanwhile, DC Mickey Webb makes a startling discovery while trailing one of local villain Ron Gregory's associates. Burt Kwouk guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Determined to prove his suspicions about Superintendent Adam Okaro, DC Mickey Webb enlists FDO Robbie Cryer's help and breaks into a house associated with Ron Gregory. Conducting a hurried search, the unlikely duo make a disturbing discovery - but before they can slip away unnoticed, the occupants return unexpectedly, trapping them in an upstairs room. Chris Simmons and Moya Brady star

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Four-part adaptation of Elizabeth Gaskell's novel following the fortunes of Margaret Hale, a privileged middle-class southerner who is forced to settle in the northern town of Milton. Over time she grows accustomed to her new surroundings and her social conscience awakens as she befriends local mill workers, and discovers the poverty and workplace struggles they face. Daniela Denby-Ashe, Lesley Manville and Sinead Cusack star

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Thornton's family questions Margaret's intentions when she intervenes in an industrial dispute at the mill. Maria's health continues to deteriorate, and desperate to see her son Frederick one last time, she pens a letter to him in Spain, begging for his return. Drama based on the novel by Elizabeth Gaskell, starring Daniela Denby-Ashe and Richard Armitage

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Margaret is drawn to Thornton despite adopting a steely resolve to aid the workers in their battle after tragedy strikes. The arrival of an unexpected visitor brings relief to Maria, whose condition has gradually deteriorated, and sparks a chain of events which causes Thornton to reach the wrong conclusion

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Margaret is forced to move away from Milton after tragedy strikes. However, when her godfather leaves her a substantial inheritance she makes a return to the North, where a twist of fate leads to an unexpected rendezvous

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Colour Blind
programme.desc: Drama from the best-selling author. Set between the wars, it concerns a girl who returns to her Tyneside home newly married to her black husband, only to encounter bigotry from all sides, to say nothing of her obsessed brother's animosity. Niamh Cusack, Tony Armatrading and Dearbhla Molloy star

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Lenny Spearfish's fortunes take a sudden turn for the better and the money suddenly starts pouring in and to top that he becomes seemingly invincible. He claims to have sold his soul to the Devil leaving his wife Alice, a God-fearing Catholic, terrified of repercussions. Offbeat detective drama, guest starring Griff Rhys Jones and Maxine Peake

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A widow steeped in classical mythology is alarmed to discover her nightmares predict impending murders in vivid detail, until Jonathan becomes the killer's nemesis and finds a more rational explanation closer to home. Drama, guest starring Rebecca Front, with Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Rupert Penry-Jones stars as Joseph Chandler, a detective hunting a modern-day serial killer mirroring the crimes of Jack the Ripper. An expert on the Victorian murderer claims a copycat is on the loose following the mysterious death of a woman in the East End, and although at first sceptical, Chandler decides to launch a major operation to stake out the area where the notorious criminal killed his second victim. Thriller, with Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Chandler's team begins to accept his methods, but struggles to find any real leads. As Buchan becomes closer to the investigation, his knowledge of Jack the Ripper's crimes helps the officers to identify a suspect - but an attempt to catch him in the act goes terribly wrong. Thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The detective takes a long-overdue holiday to look after Jenny and help her get back on her feet, only for their domestic plans to be interrupted by Ripley with news of a violent attack at a petrol station. To add to Luther's problems, Baba's heavies Frank and Toby continue to make their blackmail demands, which he knows he must follow for Jenny's sake - until he finds a way to exploit the antagonism between the two men

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Daniel suspects somebody at school might be responsible for Ryan's new-found interest in Tommy, and tries to explain that he wasn't really a dad to him. Despite Sean protesting his innocence, Jodie and John receive permission to charge him with all of the murders

programme.title: The Line of Beauty
programme.desc: By the summer of 1986, Nick finds himself living out his dreams, safely installed as a member of the Fedden household and a player on the London gay scene. His boyfriend Wani keeps their affair under wraps, desperate to protect his family name, but as Mrs Thatcher guests at Gerald and Rachel's silver wedding party Nick's world begins to crumble. Drama, starring Dan Stevens and Tim McInnerny

programme.desc: Phil manages to track down Lisa, but will a cliff top in Portugal be the scene of their final showdown?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: In a flashback, Phil recalls how he managed to track down Lisa and Lou in Portugal, and everything that happened next.

programme.title: Tenko
programme.desc: Unrest grows in the camp as rumours of the Allies' advance begin to spread, while Shinya, about to leave for battle, confesses to Dorothy that he shot Rose. Second World War drama, starring Ann Bell, Patricia Lawrence and Stephanie Beacham

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When faced with a hefty dentist bill, Lovejoy agrees to settle it by investigating the alleged death by drowning of Terence Sullivan, a fellow antiques dealer. It doesn't take long to determine that Sullivan is still alive, having taken up residence with an attractive stewardess. When Charlotte sees Lovejoy's caring side towards the 'widow', she feels she may have misjudged his character and finally gives in to his seductive charm. Pete Postlethwaite guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.desc: The race is on to find a suitable donor to save a dying leukaemia patient. Drama, starring Haydn Gwynne, Gary Mavers and Adrian Lukis

programme.desc: Zoe's push for promotion at work leaves Alec wondering about his own sense of ambition

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Vince decides to ask his father for advice for the first time in his life, and Penny learns a few home truths from her mother. Romantic comedy, starring Paul Nicholas and Jan Francis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Howard is thrown into a panic when Pearl wants to know why his underpants are missing. Peter Sallis stars

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The ladies of the village feel the need for a little excitement and hire a minibus to take them out for a picnic. However, against all the odds, their trip turns into a mystery tour. Julie T Wallace and Trevor Bannister guest star

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies' consulting detective returns to pit his inquiring mind against another festive mystery. According to a local legend, the house known as Daemons' Roost was once home to Jacob Surtees, a 19th-century sorcerer thought to have summoned the powers of Hell to terrorise and subjugate visitors. Now, it is home to Nathan Clore, an ailing film director with a dark secret, who has summoned his step-daughter Alison back home to impart to her the chilling truth of what happened to her mother and sister, who died in mysterious circumstances when she was just a child. However, mere days before Alison arrives, Nathan suffers a debilitating stroke, leaving him unable to shed any further light on the matter. Determined to get to the bottom of the mystery, Alison calls in old acquaintance Jonathan Creek to help. Also starring Sarah Alexander, Warwick Davis, Emun Elliott and Ken Bones

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Brian spends time at home making peace with himself over his dismissal, he agrees to help Esther's friend Margaret find her missing brother Peter, in the interest of keeping his mind active. Peter was the accountant of a man who has gone to prison for the murder of his wife, so Brian visits the convict hoping he will be able to assist. However, his investigation begins to encroach on the Ucos team's efforts to track down a conman who may be connected to several outstanding cases. With Rosalind Ayres and Art Malik

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature length episode. When a Cambridge farmer dies beneath the blades of a combine harvester, Sam believes the death to be a tragic accident until an anonymous tip-off indicates more sinister forces are at work. Investigating the motives of the victim's neighbour, a former soldier, Sam is able to produce few solid leads. However, when the informant is found dead, the intrepid pathologist uncovers an Army cover-up. Drama, starring Amanda Burton

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Sean becomes prime suspect when Leonie is raped, and the authorities believe he could be responsible for the string of murders Andy and the team have been investigating. Elsewhere, Daryl takes action when he is confronted by the three lads who have been bullying him. Crime drama, starring Sarah Lancashire and James Norton

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a programme looking at the family of mammals, beginning by revealing the extraordinary strategies monkeys, apes and lemurs must use to survive in the most unexpected places. In South Africa, rarely seen bush babies go in search of food in the lean times of winter, while times are also hard for a troop of bearded capuchins in Brazil's scorched badlands

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Countdown to this year's horticultural extravaganza

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sammi Kinghorn presents the first of three visits to a hill farm in Cumbria, where 16-year-old shepherd Katie recruits her for springtime chores and assisting with a surprise birth. Adam Henson looks into the dangers facing sheep and lambs from an increase in dog attacks this year, and Charlotte Smith investigates fears a 40-year-old chemical dump is threatening a village in Wales. Plus, a new regular strand following four young farmers from around the country

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce foxtrots with Anton Du Beke and explores a collection of clocks in the grounds of Belmont House in Kent. Treasures include a piece of HMS Bounty, a pair of bronze owls with some surprising contents, and a silver honey pot. Plus, Runjeet Singh explores newly discovered photographic archive revealing the story of Sikh worship in this corner of Kent

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: A haunted Terry retraces his steps from the night before. Somewhat reassured that all is okay, he accepts an invitation to a barbecue at Dean's house with his boisterous family. Meanwhile, Kate gets a lead on Michael's whereabouts and her next-door neighbour Bill goes to extreme lengths to get himself a bit of extra cash

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Manchester City v Chelsea at Etihad Stadium, Brighton & Hove Albion v Southampton at Amex Stadium and West Ham United v Leeds United and London Stadium, as vital points were contested. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the penultimate round of fixtures in the Super League, including Chelsea v Arsenal and Manchester United v Manchester City

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the case of a man whose phone was stolen right out of his hands - and his accounts drained via online banking apps. Plus, the people hoodwinked by a company claiming it was making legitimate tax rebate claims on their behalf and the problems consumers face when they don't use the internet

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A driver is ambushed by a carjacking gang outside his home in Birmingham. Data downloaded off their mobile phones helps link the gang to nearly a hundred car thefts and break-ins

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A seven-year-old boy suffers a fatal electric shock during a family visit to their local pub, leading to the discovery of a catalogue of electrical faults. Plus, a fraudster bombarding people with scam text messages claiming to be from well-known organisations

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a property in Southampton in a stunning setting, right beside the river, and another in Wellington, Shropshire being renovated with family very much in mind. Plus, a revisit to Clay Cross, Derbyshire, where in October 2018 Dion Dublin saw a plot of land with exciting development potential

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the show from Hemswell in Lincolnshire, and meets a local man who is turning antiques into innovative lamps. With experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Called out to an ongoing campaign of vandalism, Rob discovers decades of pain and a guilty secret, and comes to see the dangers of clinging to past traumas. Zara enjoys her first day at Letherbridge University, Emma regrets the events of the previous night, and Al is curious about why Rosie has returned to the Mill

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers is patrolling the forecourt of Wallyford recycling centre in East Lothian, hoping to redirect some metal railings, a tired writing bureau and a collection of marbles

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple to find a new home in the Northumberland countryside on a £375,000 budget so that they can live closer to their families

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Ncki Chapman and Angellica Bell present from the opening day of the RHS Chelsea Flower Show 2023 and are joined by experts including Rachel de Thame and Carol Klein

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts restore a small broken statue, a clock that survived the journey from Trinidad to England, and a glamorous painting that's seen better days

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey takes Lily to school to speak to the headmaster about the bullying but is mortified when she finds out the students have access to her secret cam page. Lola comes home to be greeted by the square who rally round the family for support. Freddie tries to recruit a dream-team for The Vic pub quiz

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year millions of tons of waste are dumped in landfill sites, but how safe are they? Reporter Amber Haque investigates a Staffordshire landfill which residents claim has affected their health and examines the potentially toxic legacy of historic landfill sites

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. The headteacher at a local school is still scarred by the tragic events of 30 years ago, and decides to visit Paul and the team to offer her help. In flashbacks to 1973, Paul is still adamant that the police should be connecting Sandra's case to the recent murders. With Keith Allen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs work in pairs to create special effects make-up for the BBC show Ghosts for the judging of the show's Hair and Make-up Designer Natalie Pateman. At Glow Up Studios the special effects challenges continue as they have to create a character that represents one of the zodiac signs for guest judge Vanessa Davis. In the Face Off, the bottom two contestants work against the clock to produce a symmetrical crystal embellishment design

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Norrie reflects on her first day at the clubhouse

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Snail is thrilled to be moving house

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea stages a jam attack on Tato Tower and Supertato harnesses the power of his hiccups to save it

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer's rock 'n' roll idol is stranded at the farm when his limousine breaks down, but it soon becomes clear he needs teaching a lesson or two

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Walter takes over Butch Butcher's sausage-making business

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: When Cheese tells Boy he has been the victim of a weredog staredown, he becomes convinced he will turn into a weredog too

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Three baby Monumential turtles hatch

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Oswald learns as much as he can about the mobile unit

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: Bonnie and Judith go head to head with Niamh and Sharon as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final and become ultimate champions

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The brothers explore the clever ways the zoo's animals communicate and Aaron discovers there is more to a lion's roar

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Joel goes behind the scenes at the Harry Potter and the Cursed Child stage show, while Stephen Mulhern is in the studio to show some magic of his own

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall finds out which predators have the best weapons, looking at the adder, the diamond rattlesnake, the crocodile and the barn owl

programme.title: Newsies: The Broadway Musical (2017)
programme.desc: A performance of the musical filmed at the Pantages Theatre in Hollywood, California. Set in New York City at the turn of the 20th century, the story follows Jack Kelly, a charismatic newsboy and leader of a ragged band of teenage 'newsies', who dream of a better life far from the hardship of the streets. Starring original Broadway cast members Jeremy Jordan, Kara Lindsay and Ben Fankhauser

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks present as the Butlands from Cornwall, the Lees from Warrington, the Gohil and Al-Sheikhs from London and the Whites from Selkirk each feed a family of four for £10 using ingredients from the freezer

programme.title: Great Expectations (1946)
programme.desc: An orphan falls in love with the cold-hearted adopted daughter of an eccentric old woman. A mysterious benefactor gives him the chance to rise through London's high society, but in the process he forgets his humble roots and is not prepared for the truth about the girl he loves and the stranger funding his new life. Drama, based on Charles Dickens' novel, starring John Mills, Jean Simmons, Finlay Currie and Alec Guinness

programme.title: The Remains of the Day (1993)
programme.desc: A butler in a 1930s aristocratic household has dedicated himself to serving his master, putting duty above all else and repressing his affection for the housekeeper, who also happens to be in love with him. On the outbreak of war, the nobleman's Nazi sympathies come to light, marking a change of heart in the old servant, who looks back with misgivings about the loyalty that may have cost him dearly. Period drama, with Anthony Hopkins, Emma Thompson and James Fox

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin, Caroline Hawley and Mark Stacey head to Dartmoor, where items of interest include a platinum disc awarded for Coldplay's 2005 album X&Y, which is signed by the band's members. Plus, an expert in America talks about a walking stick that is associated with General Tom Thumb

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring puts the defence of the realm before personal pride, resulting in him nearly losing command of the platoon. Classic comedy with the Home Guard, starring Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of two historic homes in the south of England. The National Trust work to preserve the gardens of Sissinghurst Castle in Kent in the same style that previous owner Vita Sackville-West planted them back in the 1930s. Twelve miles away, the Jacobean manor Bateman's was the sanctuary of Rudyard Kipling until his death in 1936. The plan is to preserve his personal possessions to tell not just the story of Kipling the author, but also the man and father

programme.title: Pet Shop Boys at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe's many appearances on the BBC, from the early days of just two men and a synth right up to the fun and flamboyance of their modern live shows. The programme also features collaborations with Liza Minnelli (Losing My Mind), Dusty Springfield (What Have I Done to Deserve This?) and David Bowie (Hallo Spaceboy)

programme.title: Reel Stories: Pet Shop Boys
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary invites Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe to join him in a London cinema and reflect on some of the pivotal moments from their career to date through clips shown on screen

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools returns to London's Alexandra Palace Theatre for another run of his music show, with the opening edition featuring performances by Irish singer-songwriter Hozier and 2021 Mercury Prize-winner Arlo Parks. Making their debuts on the programme are Irish folk musician Lisa O'Neill, San Diego trio Thee Sacred Souls and Kent singer Venbee. Jools also chat to music photographer Jill Furmanovsky about an exhibition of her work being held at the Manchester Central Library

programme.title: Radio 2 Live in Hyde Park
programme.desc: The duo's headline set at the Radio 2 festival in 2019, featuring performances of Always On My Mind, It's a Sin, Suburbia, Left to My Own Devices and West End Girls

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: A look back at the year that arguably marked the peak of new British pop as Wham!, ABC and Culture Club all made appearances. Dexys Midnight Runners' new Irish sound topped the summer charts for four weeks with Come on Eileen and their follow-up, Jackie Wilson Says, led to a notorious moment in TOTP history. It was also the year that Shalamar's Jeffrey Daniel introduced the moonwalk to British TV

programme.title: By the Grace of God (2018)
programme.desc: Three men who were all abused as children by the same Catholic priest work together to dismantle the code of silence that continues to protect their abuser decades on. Drama, starring Melvil Poupaud and Denis Ménochet. In French

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter G, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tropical gingers and tomatoes and direct sowing beans, and Rekha Mistry's shares the secrets of her success for growing aubergines on her London allotment. Elsewhere, Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, designed and planted by owners who love to recycle and repurpose as much as they can, and journalist Rosie Kinchen discusses how horticulture helped her deal with postnatal depression

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: For Mental Health Awareness Week, Charlotte Smith visits a farm in Cornwall to see how their support programmes based on agriculture help people with mental and physical wellbeing. Marathon runner Haroon Mota goes hiking in Snowdonia, exploring why the great outdoors is so important to his mental wellbeing. Datshiane Navanayagam looks at the impact increasing debt is having on farmers, and Adam Henson reports on how women in agriculture are facing up to the mental health challenges of rural isolation

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson and Lizzie Schofield present a follow-up on how the dahlia tubers planted in pots in April are coming on and show how to take dahlia cuttings. Kirsty also sows a bed around the viburnum that was moved last autumn, an area that will be particularly good for pollinators. Plus, the start of a project for a family whose newbuild house needs a garden

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits six siblings working together to futureproof their family farm in Dunbartonshire, while Cammy Wilson meets a young farmer who has diversified into deer. Arlene Stuart is in Kilmartin Glen in Argyll to shine a light on the earliest prehistoric animal carvings discovered in Scotland

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The three remaining families from yesterday's heat face an unexpected challenge in which they have to nominate one family member to cook on their own. The cooks have to tackle a lemon meringue pie - leading to pastry disasters, fruit controversy and raw egg whites. For the second task, the teams are reunited to make a two-course meal with lamb and almonds as the main ingredients. But only two families can make it through to Friday

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 12.30pm). All the action from both teams' penultimate match of the season, held at Kingsmeadow. The sides have met on three previous occasions this season, with the reverse fixture in the league ending 1-1, before Chelsea prevailed 3-1 in the FA Cup final and Arsenal earned revenge in the Continental Cup final a week later

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Castleford Tigers v Hull FC (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at The Mend-a-Hose Jungle. Both teams will be looking for morale-boosting victories having struggled in the early stages of the Super League campaign, with the Tigers hoping to make home advantage count on this occasion after narrowly losing 32-30 away to the Airlie Birds on the first weekend of the season

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: From Wallasey Town Hall on the Wirral, where antiques experts Philip Serrell and Nick Davies select the best items to take to auction. Paul Martin gets special permission to go behind the scenes with National Museums Liverpool, to find out how they preserve the millions of often priceless objects that are in their care, at the Conservation Studios in the city centre

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: The American actor travels across Italy to discover the secrets and delights of the country's regional cuisines. He begins in Naples, where he embarks on a whirlwind tour to find the freshest mozzarella and the best San Marzano tomatoes with Enzo Coccia to learn the secret art of arguably the world's best pizza. Stanley continues his journey to the island of Ischia and the beautiful Amalfi Coast to revisit some spectacular regional dishes

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a factory producing 50,000 litres of dairy ice-cream a day, while historian Ruth Goodman hops on board an ice cream van to find out how soft whip became a favourite on Britain's streets. Cherry Healey heads to an ice rink in Hull with headache expert Dr Fayyaz Ahmed, enlists an ice hockey team to test the best methods of stopping brain freeze, and also goes in search of a non-drip ice lolly

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti travel to Copenhagen to work at Nimb Hotel in Tivoli Gardens, where Giles learns how to get a table at one of the city's most avant-garde restaurant, and Monica changes light bulbs on the ornate Moroccan inspired facade

programme.title: Simon Reeve's South America
programme.desc: In the third part of his journey, Simon travels through the Andes mountains from Peru to Bolivia, beginning at the world-famous ruins of Machu Pichu. He then visits a remote valley where the mostly indigenous population farms coca leaves. the primary ingredient of cocaine. Heading across the border into Bolivia, Simon discovers how the indigenous women known as cholas have battled for increasing influence and representation

programme.title: Supernova (2020)
programme.desc: Sam and Tusker, partners of 20 years, embark on a journey across England in their old RV to visit friends, family and places from their past. Since Tusker was diagnosed with early-onset dementia two years ago, their time together is the most important thing they have. Romantic drama, starring Colin Firth and Stanley Tucci

programme.title: Miriam Margolyes: Almost Australian
programme.desc: On the second leg of her journey, Miriam is intrigued by the Australian concept of 'mateship' and how Australia is the only country in the world to enshrine this in its culture. Her first stop is a roadhouse south of Alice Springs, where she meets one of the few women truckers in Australia. She also encounters Aboriginal elders, who set up the Children's Ground to pass Arrernte traditions, songs, dances and stories on to the younger generation. Arriving in Darwin, Miriam encounters a group of transgender Tiwi islanders, who invite her to a drag night

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ashley takes Gordon to her birthday dinner at the home of Lynelle and creepy Professor Lee. Australian comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Fort William in the Highlands. On her panel are Scottish Government Cabinet Secretary for Net Zero Màiri McAllan MSP, Conservative peer and Scotland Minister Malcolm Offord, Labour's Deputy Leader in Scotland Jackie Baillie MSP, the former First Minister of Scotland and Alba Party leader Alex Salmond and the journalist Nina Myskow

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: As the CID reopen an investigation into three murders from 1973, DCI Paul Bethell tries to piece together a past that has haunted both him and a community for almost 30 years. As new advances in DNA technology provide the possibility of answers, Paul reflects on his time as a junior officer, when he became convinced that the murderer of a teenager would soon strike again. Crime drama, starring Philip Glenister

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the Conegliano region in the foothills of the Alps, to find out about the production of his favourite tipple Prosecco. One of the country's few female female wine-makers explains about the grapes they use - and when the importance of the harvest - before inviting him to spend the night in a giant wine barrel. Moving on, vintage car fan Clive joins the 100 Miglia rally and hunts for antiques in the hilltop town of Asolo

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the contest from Leominster in Herefordshire, with Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell as expert advisors. Eric also visits Hereford Cathedral's 17th-century library where the books are kept under lock and key

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef visits the fishing port of Boscastle and finds a seafood restaurant in a building which once housed rockets used to fire safety ropes out to sinking ships. A trip to Cornwall's only dedicated organic mushroom farm inspires him to cook a stir fry with 'lion's mane' mushrooms, which it is said can regrow your neurons. Rick also discovers a reason so many Germans love Cornwall

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo Beale and his team travel to Skye to transform a dated cafe and bookshop, and the interior designer takes the bold decision to spend almost all his budget on a set of huge stained-glass windows. Far from home and with tricky logistics, will this job push the team to the limit and will Banjo's ambitious gamble pay off with his clients?

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Chef James Martin journeys throughout the UK to explore how each region's conditions influence the flavour of local ingredients. After taking to the skies to get an overview of how Britain's landscape and climate affect where, what and how people farm and fish, he then touches down and meets the locals who work the land. He begins in the south-east of England, where he finds out why Kent cherries are so sweet, cooks Hastings Dover sole and prepares a cherry trifle

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Guide to enjoying summer in the countryside. Chris Packham offers tips on wildlife to look out for, Nadiya Hussain provides a barbecue recipe for lamb with rhubarb glaze, and Sean Fletcher goes on a bikepacking adventure. Narrated by Gethin Jones

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help a family of fussy eaters in Gosport on the south coast lower their food bills and change their unhealthy eating habits. James and Rianna Drew have two children, Tallulah-Belle who is three and Penelope who is one. Tallulah-Belle was born 11 weeks early weighing just one pound and now suffers with chronic lung disease. The couple spent over two years in hospital with her, living on convenience freezer food and takeaways, and now she is home their diets have not changed. Can Gregg and Chris help this family get their spending and eating habits back on track?

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margate's most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents previously unseen finds from the show's travels round the country, visiting Muncaster Castle, the Bowes Museum and Norwich Cathedral. Antiques experts include Kate Bateman, Paul Laidlaw, Jonathan Pratt, James Lewis and Thomas Plant, with items ranging from a pair of Lalique vases to a 9.5mm projector. Paul also takes a tour around Powis Castle in Wales, finding out about their collection of Indian artefacts housed on site in the Clive Museum

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to travel by train to more places around the British Isles, beginning by heading to the self-governing Isle of Man - a paradise for rail lovers. His first stop on the Manx Electric Railway is the capital of Douglas, where he reveals the island's parliament the Tynwald is older than Westminster, before the Isle of Man Steam Railway takes him down the east coast to Castletown, from where he heads to the Norse Castle Rusheword

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the history of the River Nith in the south-west, from its source in a remote forest to the shining sands of the Solway Firth. Heading downstream, he hears the story of the Knockshinnoch mining disaster - how 116 men were saved from entombment after a massive earth collapse. He also learns about the first man to make a bicycle with pedals, heads to the riverside home of Robbie Burns and finds out how a Dumfries man helped Neil Armstrong walk on the moon

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift review some of the 35 inspirational gardens on offer at the show, as well as exploring the immaculate displays of growers in the Great Pavilion. Adam Frost delves into a garden created with community in mind, Arit Anderson heads to the ingenious houseplant studios and Frances Tophill takes a first look at the planting styles to look out for at the show. Carol Klein gets viewers in the mood for summer with beautiful blooms and Sophie Raworth is on hand to welcome the royal family to the show

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The second and concluding semi-final sees two teams of four students battling it out to make it to the climax of the competition and the chance to take home the trophy. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Stories of the Troubles from people on all sides of the conflict, beginning by looking at how the situation in Northern Ireland in the late-1960s deteriorated from a time of relative peace. As the civil rights movement gained pace, demanding equal rights for Catholics, the Provisional IRA came to the fore, causing the British Army to be deployed. With the situation compounded by tactical mistakes, soldiers quickly found themselves caught up in violent clashes - leading to 13 unarmed Catholics being shot dead by British paratroopers in Derry on what becomes known as Bloody Sunday

programme.title: QI XS
programme.desc: Highlights from recent series of the comedy panel show, featuring clips on the theme of travel, hosted by Sandi Toksvig with regular panellist Alan Davies and guests

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Do the Right Thing (1989)
programme.desc: Racial tensions erupt in a Brooklyn neighbourhood on the hottest day of the summer. The simmering conflicts centre on the Italian-owned local pizza parlour, as a minor dispute gradually escalates into full-blown violence. Drama, directed by and starring Spike Lee, with Danny Aiello, John Turturro, Ossie Davis, Rosie Perez and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: For Mental Health Awareness Week, Charlotte Smith visits a farm in Cornwall to see how their support programmes based on agriculture help people with mental and physical wellbeing. Marathon runner Haroon Mota goes hiking in Snowdonia, exploring why the great outdoors is so important to his mental wellbeing. Datshiane Navanayagam looks at the impact increasing debt is having on farmers, and Adam Henson reports on how women in agriculture are facing up to the mental health challenges of rural isolation

programme.title: Wrexham: Hollywood or Bust!
programme.desc: Wrexham AFC are one of the oldest football clubs in the world, with a home in the Racecourse Ground that dates back virtually to the dawn of the sport. Theirs is a history that stretches back further than most, with drama and memorable moments to rival any club. This documentary recounts that history, while revealing why promotion to the Football League under Hollywood-based owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney would mean so much to the club's fans

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary about the life and career of the Turkish president. Recep Tayyip Erdogan was born at a time when Turkey was ruled by the secular elite. Joining an Islamist party, he became hugely popular as mayor of Istanbul. But with the national constitution forbidding the mixing of religion and politics, Erdogan was sent to prison and banned from being an MP for life - only to stage an astonishing comeback

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Following his adventures at Everest Base Camp, the intrepid traveller leaves the mountains behind and moves on to Tibet. Here he discovers that, while there may be an increasing Chinese influence, religion is once again being tolerated. He visits the Potala Palace, the spectacular monasteries of Tashilunpo and takes a dip in a hot spring. From there he continues his journey with a family of nomads heading to a summer horse festival in Yushu

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The adventurer travels along the Yangtze river into China, where he meets Mosuo singer Namu, who explains the region's traditional walking marriage ceremonies. He continues into India to marvel at one of Assam's great tea estates, makes the acquaintance of the local elephants and stays at a monastery where the monks introduce him to their unique dancing style

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Cheerful mother of three Ester is about to turn 40 and planning to celebrate the big birthday with all her friends and family. But the day before the party, she receives a phone call that turns her life upside down. Drama, starring Nina Ellen Odegaard. In Norwegian

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Ester insists on one last magical night out with her closest friends before the cancer treatment begins. But unbeknown to all of them, Charlotte makes an unsettling discovery. Drama, starring Nina Ellen Odegaard and Sara Khorami. In Norwegian

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Historian Dan Snow explores the discovery, excavation and raising of the ship, finding out what the latest research has revealed about the vessel and her crew. The presenter also investigates how the project helped create modern underwater archaeology, and examines the techniques, challenges and successes of the divers and archaeologists involved

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc: With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. The first of two documentaries offers a unique opportunity to see the very best bits of Victoria's work that she loved the most, drawing on some of the 20 sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors including Russell T Davies, Ken Loach, Winsome Pinnock, Jane Wymark and Joan Armatrading discuss Victoria's broad catalogue of award-winning comedy. Narrated by Sara Pascoe

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc: With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. This second of two programmes draws on further favourite sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors discuss her broad catalogue of award-winning comedy

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob takes Terry on a tour of their old haunts - only to reveal most of them have been demolished. Terry finds it difficult accepting that times have changed during his time away - and a job interview proves the last straw. Classic comedy, with James Bolam and Rodney Bewes

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Following his adventures at Everest Base Camp, the intrepid traveller leaves the mountains behind and moves on to Tibet. Here he discovers that, while there may be an increasing Chinese influence, religion is once again being tolerated. He visits the Potala Palace, the spectacular monasteries of Tashilunpo and takes a dip in a hot spring. From there he continues his journey with a family of nomads heading to a summer horse festival in Yushu

programme.title: John Williams at the BBC
programme.desc: Performances featuring the guitarist, from a BBC archive spanning 50 years. The programme includes classical masterworks, the prog rock of Sky and comedy with Eric Sykes. There are also duets with fellow guitar maestro Julian Bream

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The naturalist is joined by his stepdaughter and fellow wildlife presenter Megan McCubbin on stage at the Royal Albert Hall as Ben Palmer conducts the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra in music from BBC natural history documentaries. The concert is an audiovisual celebration of the corporation's world-famous Natural History Unit, from David Attenborough's pioneering early adventures through to Frozen Planet II, with images, natural sounds, spoken word sections and music by composers including Hans Zimmer and George Fenton

programme.title: Hans Zimmer: Hollywood Rebel
programme.desc: Profile of the Oscar-winning composer responsible for some of the best-loved film and TV scores of the past few decades. Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob follows the artist over the course of 12 months to chart her creative process, talking about her life to date and how she sees the rest of her career. Tracey discusses her troubled early years in Margate and the series of breakthroughs in the 1990s that saw her become a leading light of the Young British Artists, featuring career-defining work like My Bed and her embroidered tent Everyone I Have Ever Slept With 1963-1995. Contributors include Nicholas Serota, Jay Jopling, Maria Balshaw and David Dawson

programme.title: Simon Schama Meets
programme.desc: The presenter speaks to some of the world's most influential contemporary artists and activists. Ai Weiwei discusses his journey to being a voice for the downtrodden, and how his father was both a key figure in the Communist rise to power, only to fall foul of the state during the Cultural Revolution

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc: Life in the German capital in the year the Second World War ended, told through the stories of those who experienced it - from ordinary Germans to the Allied forces who entered the city. In the final episode, the British, French and Americans troop wait to enter Berlin, while members of the Jewish community, among whom there are few survivors, regroup

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The naturalist is joined by his stepdaughter and fellow wildlife presenter Megan McCubbin on stage at the Royal Albert Hall as Ben Palmer conducts the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra in music from BBC natural history documentaries. The concert is an audiovisual celebration of the corporation's world-famous Natural History Unit, from David Attenborough's pioneering early adventures through to Frozen Planet II, with images, natural sounds, spoken word sections and music by composers including Hans Zimmer and George Fenton

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The development of the steamship, from the earliest paddle boats and the first iron-hulled vessels to modern sport screw propellers and ships powered by steam turbines, such as the Royal Yacht Britannia

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Venice, using 3D technology to discover how a city built in a swamp came to be one of the most powerful locations in Medieval Europe. The pair dive deep into the many canals in this unique place to experience how its buildings still remain standing to this day, and highlight how Venice's beauty once masked a ruthless secret state, and a world of excess and vice

programme.title: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the Italian city is subject to constant environmental issues, which are becoming more commonplace due to the impact of climate change

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: The concluding episode follows the aftermath of the shock news that the Elizabeth Line has been delayed by over a year, and will cost hundreds of millions of pounds more than planned. As the drama unfolds, engineers, technicians and train staff pull together to work on borrowed time, and must learn to operate the new trains and test out the new twin tunnels under London before it can open to the public

programme.title: Building Britain's Biggest Nuclear Power Station
programme.desc: Part two of two. Following the challenges involved with building the Hinkley Point C in the remote Somerset countryside, the first new nuclear power station in Britain for a generation. This time, the team creates an extensive flood defence system to protect the site from a nuclear disaster like the one that befell the Fukushima Daiichi power plant in Japan. Elsewhere, cameras follow specialists as they work to uncover unexploded Second World War bombs that threaten the installation of the 4500-tonne cooling water intake heads

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc: Storm chasers and photographers track the global changes in storms and floods across America, while Nasa's Grace satellites reveal global overuse of aquifers

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc: The documentary explores how novels through the ages have embraced the class struggle, from Dickens, Gaskell and Hardy through to Robert Tressell's The Ragged-Trousered Philanthropists and the group of working-class writers who began to write their own stories in post-war Britain. With readings by Russell Tovey, Darren Boyd, Alex Macqueen, Emily Berrington, Freddie Fox, Rian Gordon and Olivia Barrowclough

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The Go Jetters are going to Westman Islands, Iceland, where the world's largest colony of Atlantic puffins gathers every year. Lars loves these tough little birds and explains how, although they spend most of their lives flying out to sea and fishing, they return to land each year to lay their eggs. When the baby birds, also called pufflings, eventually hatch, they fly out towards the ocean. But the light from nearby towns often confuses them about where to go, leading local children and adults to form 'puffin patrols' to rescue the pufflings. Lars is excited to help out but is upset when he discovers Glitch, also a fan of puffins, is already well-known on the islands for his skills as a puffin rescuer. Although Glitch offers him a place in his puffin patrol, Lars is determined to outdo Glitch with a patrol of his own - but when he recruits a clumsy Grimbot, things take a turn for the worse...

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey takes Lily to school to speak to the headmaster about the bullying but is mortified when she finds out the students have access to her secret cam page. Lola comes home to be greeted by the square who rally round the family for support. Freddie tries to recruit a dream-team for The Vic pub quiz

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway, visits Usk for a stunning 10-mile circular walk which starts and ends at Usk Castle. Along the way, he sees the landscape from above as he hitches a ride in a glider, learns about an ancient orchard, visits some community allotments and helps local youngsters plant sunflowers. Archaeologist Dr Erin Lloyd Jones finds out what the Romans did for Wales and Matthew Bassett explores decorative Oriental-inspired tinware once made in the town

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year millions of tons of waste are dumped in landfill sites, but how safe are they? Reporter Amber Haque investigates a Staffordshire landfill which residents claim has affected their health and examines the potentially toxic legacy of historic landfill sites

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. The headteacher at a local school is still scarred by the tragic events of 30 years ago, and decides to visit Paul and the team to offer her help. In flashbacks to 1973, Paul is still adamant that the police should be connecting Sandra's case to the recent murders. With Keith Allen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: The daily reality for rookie nurses - especially in A&E - as they deal with life-and-death situations and everything in between. Twenty-two-year-old Mikey is part of the trauma team tasked with helping a teenage rugby player brought in by ambulance with severe concussion in Carmarthen. In Aberystwyth, 24-year-old nurse is Leah is unphased when a patient arrives having suffered a freak lawnmower accident which led to an amputation. Amid medical dramas on the wards, there's a big moment for health care assistant Caitlin who, after years of studying, is on her way to collect her new nurses uniform, and is excited to join her colleagues in her blues

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs work in pairs to create special effects make-up for the BBC show Ghosts for the judging of the show's Hair and Make-up Designer Natalie Pateman. At Glow Up Studios the special effects challenges continue as they have to create a character that represents one of the zodiac signs for guest judge Vanessa Davis. In the Face Off, the bottom two contestants work against the clock to produce a symmetrical crystal embellishment design

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by writer and comedian Ben Elton, with chefs Sabrina Ghayour and Max La Manna. Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Mary Berry - Love to Cook
programme.desc: In Carmarthen Bay, Mary and daughter Annabel meet forager Craig Evans. Armed with his vast knowledge of edible plants, they indulge in their two loves - the great outdoors and cooking. Mary then travels to Cumbria to meet Carlisle-born Harrison, whose friends helped him to turn his life around and discover solace through the great outdoors. Dishes include roast fillet of beef with fresh horseradish, served with a magical platter of vegetables

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Nottingham Forest v Arsenal and Manchester City v Chelsea

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts from Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, where experts Tim Weeks and Charles Hanson assist the reds and blues as they vie, hoping to make the greater profit at auction. Away from the contest, Charlie learns about one of the bravest British heroines of the 20th century

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Leeds Rhinos v Wigan Warriors (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Headingley Stadium. Wigan lifted the trophy last season, defeating Huddersfield Giants 16-14 in the final, while Leeds were eliminated at home to Castleford Tigers at this stage, but will be expecting to an improved performance this time around as they look to emulate their last triumph in the competition in 2020

programme.title: Sportscene Results
programme.desc: David Currie presents a round-up of the afternoon's main football news and results. Plus, a look back at the week's talking points

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and brothers David and Harry Rich take on the job of redesigning an unusually shaped garden in Droitwich Spa, Worcestershire. Lionel loves firing up the BBQ to cook for the family, but he and wife Paulette also want a tranquil space to relax in. Can the designers come up with a zoned plot with plenty of screening that ticks all the boxes?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. In each episode, contestants are guided by a host of celebrity experts, with tonight's advice coming from Anton Du Beke, Josie Gibson, Iain Stirling, Kadeena Cox, Nigel Ng, Tony Blackburn and Emma Barnett

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy game show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. Taking part this time around are Sally Lindsay, Andi Oliver, Chris McCausland, Jimmy Carr, Sophie Ellis-Bextor and Melvin Odoom

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Phil Tufnell, Mark Butcher, Cece Lightfoot, Pooja Shah, Chris McCausland, Sarah Keyworth, Ritchie Neville and Scott Robinson try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jodie's drink is spiked during a night out, but she is able to call Rida for help. When she makes it to the emergency department, Faith offers her support, but a furious Max assumes she is drunk. Ryan feels he is not being given enough opportunity to prove his worth, while Teddy worries about asking Paige out

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker as DI Annika Strandhed, who has returned to Glasgow to head up the Marine Homicide Unit, where she is tasked with solving puzzling crimes and unexplained murders that wash up in Scotland's waters. On her first day in a new role, Annika is called in to solve the murder of a man found in the Clyde, with a harpoon piercing his head

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Bournemouth v Manchester United at Vitality Stadium and Nottingham Forest v Arsenal at The City Ground and Liverpool v Aston Villa at Anfield, as valuable points were up for grabs at both ends of the table. Plus, Tottenham Hotspur v Brentford, Fulham v Crystal Palace and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Everton

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, featuring Celtic v St Mirren at Celtic Park, Hearts v Aberdeen at Tynecastle, Kilmarnock v St Johnstone at Rugby Park, Livingston v Dundee United at Tony Macaroni Arena and Motherwell v Ross County at Fir Park

programme.title: The Mercy (2017)
programme.desc: The story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe in 1968. The struggles he confronted on the controversial voyage, while his family awaited his return, is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent times. Factual drama, starring Colin Firth, David Thewlis and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Roger Johnson and Rachel Burden present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Bournemouth v Manchester United at Vitality Stadium and Nottingham Forest v Arsenal at The City Ground and Liverpool v Aston Villa at Anfield, as valuable points were up for grabs at both ends of the table. Plus, Tottenham Hotspur v Brentford, Fulham v Crystal Palace and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Everton

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: The Sunday Show
programme.desc: Martin Geissler brings you all the main issues from the world of politics and beyond. Big interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore a three bedroom semi in West Bromwich, a flat in Stoneycroft in Liverpool and a Grade II listed building in Whitehaven in Cumbria

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the 10k race, as the elite runners looked to emulate last year's winners Jake Robertson and Helen Obiri, and many more athletes of all abilities raised money for charity

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum joins two nuns on a St Patrick pilgrimage, walking and kayaking to sacred sites in County Down, Northern Ireland. She also visits the 12th-century Cistercian Priory

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple search Norfolk and Suffolk, hoping to find a new home within reach of their £400,000 budget. Jules Hudson helps out and also visits a new wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: The Railway Children (1970)
programme.desc: Three Edwardian children are forced to leave their comfortable middle-class London home and move to the wilds of Yorkshire after their father is wrongfully imprisoned for treason. Family drama adapted from E Nesbit's story, starring Jenny Agutter, Sally Thomsett, Gary Warren, Dinah Sheridan, Bernard Cribbins, William Mervyn and Iain Cuthbertson

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a programme looking at the family of mammals, beginning by revealing the extraordinary strategies monkeys, apes and lemurs must use to survive in the most unexpected places. In South Africa, rarely seen bush babies go in search of food in the lean times of winter, while times are also hard for a troop of bearded capuchins in Brazil's scorched badlands

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Countdown to this year's horticultural extravaganza

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sammi Kinghorn presents the first of three visits to a hill farm in Cumbria, where 16-year-old shepherd Katie recruits her for springtime chores and assisting with a surprise birth. Adam Henson looks into the dangers facing sheep and lambs from an increase in dog attacks this year, and Charlotte Smith investigates fears a 40-year-old chemical dump is threatening a village in Wales. Plus, a new regular strand following four young farmers from around the country

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce foxtrots with Anton Du Beke and explores a collection of clocks in the grounds of Belmont House in Kent. Treasures include a piece of HMS Bounty, a pair of bronze owls with some surprising contents, and a silver honey pot. Plus, Runjeet Singh explores newly discovered photographic archive revealing the story of Sikh worship in this corner of Kent

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: A haunted Terry retraces his steps from the night before. Somewhat reassured that all is okay, he accepts an invitation to a barbecue at Dean's house with his boisterous family. Meanwhile, Kate gets a lead on Michael's whereabouts and her next-door neighbour Bill goes to extreme lengths to get himself a bit of extra cash

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Manchester City v Chelsea at Etihad Stadium, Brighton & Hove Albion v Southampton at Amex Stadium and West Ham United v Leeds United and London Stadium, as vital points were contested. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Action from Hibernian v Rangers at Easter Road, plus a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the penultimate round of fixtures in the Super League, including Chelsea v Arsenal and Manchester United v Manchester City

programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards count down those Premier League players most adept at using sly tactics to gain an advantage

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the case of a man whose phone was stolen right out of his hands - and his accounts drained via online banking apps. Plus, the people hoodwinked by a company claiming it was making legitimate tax rebate claims on their behalf and the problems consumers face when they don't use the internet

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A driver is ambushed by a carjacking gang outside his home in Birmingham. Data downloaded off their mobile phones helps link the gang to nearly a hundred car thefts and break-ins

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A seven-year-old boy suffers a fatal electric shock during a family visit to their local pub, leading to the discovery of a catalogue of electrical faults. Plus, a fraudster bombarding people with scam text messages claiming to be from well-known organisations

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a property in Southampton in a stunning setting, right beside the river, and another in Wellington, Shropshire being renovated with family very much in mind. Plus, a revisit to Clay Cross, Derbyshire, where in October 2018 Dion Dublin saw a plot of land with exciting development potential

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the show from Hemswell in Lincolnshire, and meets a local man who is turning antiques into innovative lamps. With experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey

programme.desc: Called out to an ongoing campaign of vandalism, Rob discovers decades of pain and a guilty secret, and comes to see the dangers of clinging to past traumas. programme.desc: Ncki Chapman and Angellica Bell present from the opening day of the RHS Chelsea Flower Show 2023 and are joined by experts including Rachel de Thame and Carol Klein
