programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple to find a new home in the Northumberland countryside on a £375,000 budget so that they can live closer to their families

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Ncki Chapman and Angellica Bell present from the opening day of the RHS Chelsea Flower Show 2023 and are joined by experts including Rachel de Thame and Carol Klein

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts restore a small broken statue, a clock that survived the journey from Trinidad to England, and a glamorous painting that's seen better days

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey takes Lily to school to speak to the headmaster about the bullying but is mortified when she finds out the students have access to her secret cam page. Lola comes home to be greeted by the square who rally round the family for support. Freddie tries to recruit a dream-team for The Vic pub quiz

programme.title: Family Footsteps
programme.desc: With Gavin Andrews as their guide the Quail-Walker family travel further back in time. Teenagers Noah and Fionn hop on a steam train to find out about a family connection to the railways while Grandad Desmond discovers a shocking family secret. In London, Fionn and Noah play cello and viola with a composer cousin they've never met and find out about their family links to The Sound of Music and Frank Sinatra

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year millions of tons of waste are dumped in landfill sites, but how safe are they? Reporter Amber Haque investigates a Staffordshire landfill which residents claim has affected their health and examines the potentially toxic legacy of historic landfill sites

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. The headteacher at a local school is still scarred by the tragic events of 30 years ago, and decides to visit Paul and the team to offer her help. In flashbacks to 1973, Paul is still adamant that the police should be connecting Sandra's case to the recent murders. With Keith Allen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Peninsula Nurses
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following the Ards Peninsula district nurses as they care for patients in their own homes. In a busy day, Gemma monitors the blood sugar levels of a retired minister near Donaghadee, while Tanya heads to Portaferry to take pre-chemotherapy blood samples from a cancer patient. As Claire prepares to move to a new team, she pays a final visit to a patient she has looked after for years

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs work in pairs to create special effects make-up for the BBC show Ghosts for the judging of the show's Hair and Make-up Designer Natalie Pateman. At Glow Up Studios the special effects challenges continue as they have to create a character that represents one of the zodiac signs for guest judge Vanessa Davis. In the Face Off, the bottom two contestants work against the clock to produce a symmetrical crystal embellishment design

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan gets obsessed with a 1960s television show after picking up a second-hand TV, soon entering a fantasy world. Meanwhile, Roger decides to live as a baby and the family cares for him. With the guest voice of Edward Asner

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: When the Memari's get robbed, Francine orders Stan to spare no expense and he installs the most sophisticated system possible. However, her paranoia takes hold and she begins to regard everything as a possible threat. Meanwhile, Steve tries to adopt Hayley's laid-back approach to school work in the hope it will improve his grades

programme.title: All American
programme.desc: Laura notices that Olivia has become more withdrawn, so she allows her and Jordan to take a mental-health day to get some much-needed twin bonding time

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining four chefs are challenged to create a stunning seafood dish that will be featured in Entertainment Weekly magazine

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson narrates a selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: World's Funniest Videos
programme.desc: Hilarious video clips featuring unfortunate people in side-splitting situations.

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson narrates a selection of peculiar record-breaking attempts. This edition features the most yard sticks broken with the head in one minute, most times jumping into a pair of underwear in 30 seconds and the largest underwater human pyramid

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: In London, three singletons compete in a series of shopping challenges as they attempt to win the affections of musician Robert. Fashion-themed dating series

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Peyton and Haley seize a chance to introduce their musical act when the gang watches a performance by the Honorary Title. Carrie tries to get closer to Nathan, and Mouth is set up on a blind date with Millicent. Chad Michael Murray stars

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: Dawson accidentally leaves his camera running all night, and later finds he has unwittingly filmed Tamara and a mystery man making love outdoors. Meanwhile, Jen finally yields to the inevitable and reveals why her parents sent her to Capeside. James Van Der Beek and Michelle Williams star

programme.title: Secret Crush
programme.desc: Rapper K-Dogg has got his work cut out trying to impress Makayla, while Ellis makes a move on his best friend Maddie,a nd Aanya takes a punt on finding love at work

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Three singletons go up against each other in Manchester, where they try to win the affections of fashion stylist Courtney by each buying him an outfit

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, former Made in Chelsea star Ashley James chooses three men to date based on the menus she most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again

programme.title: Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo hosts this revamped version of the game show in which the Wilson family from Worcester take on the Popat family from Harrow. The family who score the most points go through to Big Money, which sees two of them answering just five questions for the £30,000 jackpot

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: The spy locates the scientist who created the Intersect database implanted in his mind, while tension mounts between the Buy More crew and their Beverly Hills counterparts

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Haley struggles to decide whether she should reveal information that could ruin Lucas's relationship. Mouth tries to convince Millicent he is a nice guy, while Nathan's marriage is threatened. Chad Michael Murray and James Lafferty star

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: As a hurricane moves inland, threatening Capeside, the gang takes refuge at Mr and Mrs Leery's house. However, the weather outside gives way to storms of a different nature as Dawson criticises Jen about her promiscuous past and Mitch learns of wife Gale's affair

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, former Geordie Shore star Ricci Guarnaccio chooses three ladies to date based on the menus he most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts another charity edition of the game show, with Lady Leshurr, Gabby Logan and Adam Thomas trying to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the good cause of their choice

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Jonah tries to help Mateo avoid claiming compensation when he is injured, in case his immigration status is revealed. Amy tries to persuade everyone that she likes Kelly

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Garrett and Cheyenne take advantage of a policy giving employees amnesty if they confess any misdeeds, while Jonah and Amy deal with a situation that has the whole store talking

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Louise discovers Mr Frond's plan to have the students evaluate the teachers. Bob and Linda cannot agree on their final resting place

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Bob and Linda are invited to a Valentine's Day dinner at a fancy restaurant on Kingshead Island

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois fulfils a lifelong ambition by becoming a model, much to the displeasure of Peter and her father. Meanwhile, Brian works for Stewie's marketing company to pay for the treatment of an embarrassing problem

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian embarks on a relationship with a teacher, causing him to neglect Peter - who responds by befriending actor James Woods instead. Meanwhile, Stewie becomes so agitated by The Da Vinci Code that he is unable to sleep

programme.title: Plebs: Soldiers of Rome (2022)
programme.desc: Feature-length conclusion to the sitcom about a group of desperate young men from the suburbs of ancient Rome. Marcus, Grumio, Jason and Aurelius join the army in peacetime in the hope of winning respect, romance, but when war is declared, they are sent to fight on the front line for a cause that they don't believe in. Starring Tom Rosenthal and Ryan Sampson

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg becomes convinced she is unattractive to boys, so Lois takes her for the ultimate makeover. Meanwhile, Peter tries to start a band with the guys - and his efforts result in the entire family appearing on Saturday Night Live

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Jeff wins a tour through a mysterious weed factory and brings Stan along. Animated comedy about a man who will stop at nothing to protect his country

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Hayley finds herself pushed aside when Jeff's racing greyhound Fleabiscuit wins the Chimdale Stakes. Klaus, believing that the mechanical rabbit Wizbo is too plain looking, sets out to give it a little more personality and ends up going for a wild ride

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Teddy is forced to face his past when Linda encourages him to attend a farewell ceremony for the ship on which he served in the Navy

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Gene reluctantly agrees to star in a music video for Courtney. Teddy and Linda are obsessed with a mysterious customer at the restaurant

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Jeff leaves Cloud 9 to work at a rival shop, while Garrett convinces Glenn that he is poaching employees. Comedy, starring America Ferrera and Colton Dunn

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: The employees worry when their new district manager arrives. Amy and Jonah search for ways to raise money so that no one is fired

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Oliver has a new accident-prone assistant in his antique shop, and Simon is unhappy when Aunt Eleanor offers his bed to an old schoolfriend who has fallen on hard times

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: First episode of the drama, starring Michael Kitchen as a jaded police superintendent who would rather be fighting the enemy in France than crime on the south coast as the Second World War gathers pace in 1940. However, when a local magistrate's German wife is murdered amid a growing cloud of uncertainty and anti-Nazi feeling, the ensuing investigation is anything but routine. Edward Fox, Robert Hardy, David Horovitch, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks co-star

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: As the Second World War continues to rage, Foyle investigates a pro-Hitler organisation he suspects may be linked to a mysterious death at the White Feather Hotel, while reluctant assistant Milner struggles to decide where his loyalties lie. Crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Anthony Howell, with Charles Dance and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The unassuming detective launches an investigation when a conscientious objector dies while in police custody, and the judge who ordered his arrest is nearly killed in his booby-trapped home. His inquiries uncover a web of lies and corruption in the heart of wartime Hastings. Crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen and David Tennant

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The detective is faced with a dilemma when a murder investigation leads him to the radar station where his missing son was working on a highly classified operation - just as Hitler launches a major offensive on Britain's RAF airfields. To solve the mystery, Foyle must penetrate the closed ranks of the airforce. Second World War crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, Julian Ovenden, Honeysuckle Weeks, Anthony Calf, Roger Allam and Anton Lesser

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The year is 1940, and Sam is made homeless when a bomb destroys her boarding house, alerting Foyle to a system of organised looting around Hastings. However, when a corpse is found on the beach, the investigation brings the team into conflict with British attempts to secure vital American aid for the war effort. Police drama, starring Michael Kitchen, with Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A land dispute escalates during a cowboy fair run by the Wild West Society in the village of Ford Florey. Farmers Jack Fincher and Silas Burbage both claim to own a patch of wasteland known as the Swamp, but Dan Malko wants to buy it and create a travellers' site. Barnaby and Jones are called in when the feud leads to murder during the Wild West-style shoot-outs at the annual event. Guest starring Kenneth Cranham, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce Barnaby swerves off the road into a ditch, convinced she has hit someone, but nobody is found injured and Tom thinks she has imagined it. However, when a local historian discovers the body of a librarian in a nearby cemetery, Joyce blames herself for the man's death, leading her husband into a spooky investigation to find the real killer on the loose in the haunted village of March Magna. Guest starring Danny Webb (The Bill), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a music masterclass led by a renowned pianist, a shy prodigy suffers a panic attack and runs off to a nearby river. To her horror, she witnesses a woman drowning and a baby left on the riverbank. But when Barnaby arrives, there is no sign of the victim - and he is struck by similarities to another mysterious case that happened 20 years ago at the same spot. Guest starring veteran actor James Fox and Coronation Street's Ian Puleston-Davies (Owen Armstrong), alongside former Corrie star Richard Fleeshman (Craig Harris)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Former nanny Lavinia Seagram is found soaked in blood and it is believed she had turned to drink and drugs to commit suicide. However, Poirot is soon on the scent of troubled heiress Norma Restarick, who had problems of her own - not least confessing to the possibility she has killed someone herself. Guest starring Jemima Rooper, Zoe Wanamaker and Peter Bowles, with David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: In a retrospective episode set immediately after the events of series two, Rachel faces further accusations of masterminding the fatal attack on ex-lover Nick and finds comfort in the arms of ever-faithful Sean, agreeing to marry him. Amid the wedding celebrations, Janet and Ade admit defeat and decide to split up for good, while Gill is duty bound to take action when she catches Pete in a compromising position. The detectives also investigate the case of a businessman suspected of murdering a homeless man

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver find themselves on the wrong side of the law when they set off on a joyride in the vicar's Bentley. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The Oxford detective faces a tough time while looking into a murder at a peaceful college. After suffering the familiar pangs of unrequited love, he clashes with the unpleasant college master and then unwittingly provides his main suspects with a watertight alibi. John Thaw and Kevin Whately star, with Robert Stephens, Amanda Burton and Philip Middlemiss

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The badly beaten body of 18-year-old clerk Sylvia Kane is found in a pub car park by her boyfriend John Sanders. Called in to investigate, Morse finds a coded letter in her bag and sets about trying to decipher it, gradually unravelling a tangled web of hidden passion and corruption at the insurance office where she worked. John Thaw and Kevin Whately star, with Anthony Bate, Terrence Hardiman, Jill Baker, Holly Aird and Ingrid Lacey

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Maggie gets the all-clear from the doctor and decides she will return to Bude, forcing PC Penhale to take desperate measures to persuade her to stay in Portwenn. Ruth uncovers a raft of family heirlooms while clearing out a barn at the farm, and the mounting tension between Martin and Louisa peaks when she discovers he has booked a date for James Henry's christening without consulting her

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Bert struggles to come up with the money to repay loan sharks Alastair and Norman Tonken, who gave him £1,000 to clear his debts. Eleanor falls ill and Martin diagnoses a strangulated hernia, but when the ambulance goes to the wrong village, he has no alternative but to perform the emergency operation himself in his surgery. With Martin Clunes, Ian McNeice and Louise Jameson

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: A series of scandals makes for an interesting few days in the quiet village of St Mary Mead, and most seem to revolve around a blustering local colonel, whose brusque manner and short temper make him unpopular with his fellow villagers. When he is found dead with a bullet through the head, Miss Marple and the reluctant DI Slack investigate. Whodunit, starring Geraldine McEwan as Miss Marple, with Jane Asher, Jason Flemying, Derek Jacobi and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates her friend Elspeth McGillicuddy's claim to have witnessed a murder being committed on a passing train during a rail journey, but everyone is stumped by the lack of a body. Mystery, starring Geraldine McEwan, Pam Ferris, Niamh Cusack, John Hannah, Amanda Holden, Griff Rhys Jones, David Warner, Jenny Agutter and Rob Brydon

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: An unusual message appears in Chipping Cleghorn's local newspaper, revealing details of a forthcoming murder and, while at first glance it looks like a practical joke, the information proves to be deadly accurate. Miss Marple helps Inspector Craddock with his investigation and the pair soon uncover several likely suspects in the village. Feature-length drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Zoe Wanamaker, Elaine Paige, Virginia McKenna, Cherie Lunghi and Frances Barber

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: When a respectable GP is found dead in a public lavatory, the young Morse's outlandish theories see him relegated to general duties by the newly arrived Chief Superintendent Bright. Humiliated and humbled, Endeavour has to investigate from the sidelines, but it's not long before he's questioning DI Fred Thursday's orders and risking his career to avert a family tragedy. Shaun Evans stars, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell return to tell incredible stories of people desperate to find missing family and answer questions that have haunted entire lives. This week features two stories of children searching for their birth mothers after life-changing events - former Scotland footballer Dominic Matteo, who started to search after suffering a life-threatening brain tumour, and a woman, pained with emotion on her wedding day because her birth mother was missing

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The last run of the detective drama ended with Lewis (Kevin Whately) starting a new life away from the force, but it seems that peace and quiet doesn't suit him - which is just as well, as newly promoted DI Hathaway (Laurence Fox) is struggling to find a sidekick, and within just four weeks is already on to his second sergeant, DS Lizzie Maddox (Angela Griffin). So, Chief Superintendent Innocent (Rebecca Front) decides to reunite the former partners to look into the murder of a neurosurgeon, a case with potential links to the worlds of animal rights and blood sports. In the first of this two-part story, suspicion falls on glamorous widow Erica (Kara Tointon), but it turns out there are plenty of other people in the victim's inner circle who were driven by fear and loathing

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Damon thinks he has become a dingo after eating Irene's drugs, and Vera offers support and advice from the trailer park after Karen gives birth. Comedy, starring Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Irene is left holding the baby after Karen gets back to her nightclubbing routine with Lesley, and Vera moves out of the trailer park with grand-daughter Sabrina. Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid star

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Laurence embarks on another London trip, leaving his lovelorn wife Elizabeth at home. On overhearing a saucy chat between two servants, her uncontrollable jealousy prompts her to sack them both. Gordon Jackson, Nicola Pagett and Ian Ogilvy star

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of a wealthy man whose double life left him vulnerable to exploitation. Away from work, Rachel's recent moment of indiscretion threatens to come back to haunt her when a confused Sean takes a phone call from her one-night stand, and after Ade is pushed into living with his girlfriend on a permanent basis, Janet asks her mother to move in

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: An aristocrat goes missing, along with his collection of explicit erotic paintings - and Morse's investigation provides him with a close-up view of the upper crust's dark side. What is more, there is a further culture shock lying in wait - the prospect of working with a new female pathologist. Starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Amanda Hillwood, Patricia Hodge and Clifford Rose

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: When Ringo wins a holiday, Simon and Oliver are soon vying to accompany him. Comedy, with Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Pearl accepts a date with Len, Lisa feels torn between two lovers and Robert fears it's only a matter of time before Elaine remembers the accident

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: As Terry wakes, Dawn realises her life has changed forever and she breaks down. Zak gets arrested for jumping bail and Elaine goes for a drive with Robert

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sally is forced to choose between Kevin and Alex at the registry office, while the Nelsons get the cold shoulder and Steve finds it impossible to wangle the truth from Vik

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The Nelsons take action to clear their name, Kevin and Sally try to put the drama of the wedding ceremony behind them and Vik attempts to get back in Steve's good books

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: A female trainee arrives at the depot and attracts the attention of the men - until they discover she is the inspector's niece

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan buys a home brew kit and begins making his own beer - but underestimates its strength and turns up for work in no fit state to drive a bus. Comedy, starring Reg Varney

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny oversees an animal translocation for his first big project as state vet, but Alice struggles to run the clinic in his absence and has a close encounter with lions. Meanwhile, Du Plessis' attempt to show Caroline the 'real Africa' backfires when he takes her on a no-frills camping trip in the wilderness. Stephen Tompkinson, Dawn Steele, Deon Stewardson and Hayley Mills star

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: When strange events occur at Leopard's Den - a mirror cracks seemingly for no reason, elephants and lions are spotted miles away from their normal habitat, and crocodiles are found dead - Danny and Alice must work fast to solve the mystery before more animals die. Meanwhile, Du Plessis discovers a pregnancy test while tidying up, but jumps to the wrong conclusion

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sian Horrocks is assaulted on her way home from work and tells Mike it was a local man who did the deed - but Jackie suspects there is more to the case than meets the eye. Elsewhere, Greengrass dreams up a scheme to fleece punters with a new investment. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr, Fiona Dolman and Samia Smith

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A fire at the home of a talented artist leads to suspicions of an arson attack, and the resultant police investigation exposes the man's patron as a likely suspect. Greengrass has limited success running a B&B, and Andy tells landlady Gina he has got to make a business trip to Scotland, filling Blaketon with misgivings. Joe McGann guest stars, with Jason Durr, Bill Maynard and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: The enormity of Terry's condition and his devastating prognosis hit Dawn for six. Robert grows increasingly edgy as Elaine grapples with her confusing flashback

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sam forces Zak and Lisa to face up to their feelings, while Cain takes Debbie for a birthday drink - much to Louise's consternation

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: As the factory girls let their hair down at their Christmas party, Karen shows Joe just how grateful she is for being given time off work at such short notice

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Dev hits the roof when he finds out Vik has gone on holiday with Steve and Karen. Tommy pays a high price for guarding the family secret

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: Sam and Foyle are shot at and almost run over by a speeding vehicle, and discover the incident is part of an illicit fuel racket. An undercover investigation reveals the detective's son Andrew to be involved, and the discovery that a driver at the petrol company has been murdered complicates matters further. Wartime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, Honeysuckle Weeks and Julian Ovenden

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie fights for justice on behalf of a trespasser shot on Lord Ashfordly's land, and Greengrass uses his new job as a newspaper columnist to criticise assorted pillars of society. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, Fiona Dolman and Rupert Vansittart.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A handsome new locum wins Maggie's heart but soon falls out of favour with the locals when a misdiagnosis results in tragedy. A display of courage by Andy reconciles him with Gina, and Greengrass's bike hire business turns out to be seriously flawed _ much to Ventress's discomfort. Rural drama, starring Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse meets his intellectual match when a serial killer haunting the streets of Oxford keeps himself one step ahead of the law and leaves cryptic messages to goad the police. At first glance, it seems to be the work of a deranged lunatic, but the elaborate staging of the crimes suggests method in the madness - and a macabre sharing of the sleuth's passion for opera. Starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Psychologist Tony Hill investigates what appears to be the honour killing of a Kurdish woman. However, the site where the body was found yields remains of other victims and an even more gruesome motive for the crimes. New colleague Chris Collins seems reluctant to pull his weight when a middle-aged teacher of his acquaintance is added to a growing list of the dead. Robson Green and Cristian Solimeno star in the thriller based on the novels by Val McDermid

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny oversees an animal translocation for his first big project as state vet, but Alice struggles to run the clinic in his absence and has a close encounter with lions. After suffering the familiar pangs of unrequited love, he clashes with the unpleasant college master and then unwittingly provides his main suspects with a watertight alibi. John Thaw and Kevin Whately star, with Robert Stephens, Amanda Burton and Philip Middlemiss

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The badly beaten body of 18-year-old clerk Sylvia Kane is found in a pub car park by her boyfriend John Sanders. Called in to investigate, Morse finds a coded letter in her bag and sets about trying to decipher it, gradually unravelling a tangled web of hidden passion and corruption at the insurance office where she worked. John Thaw and Kevin Whately star, with Anthony Bate, Terrence Hardiman, Jill Baker, Holly Aird and Ingrid Lacey

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Maggie gets the all-clear from the doctor and decides she will return to Bude, forcing PC Penhale to take desperate measures to persuade her to stay in Portwenn. Ruth uncovers a raft of family heirlooms while clearing out a barn at the farm, and the mounting tension between Martin and Louisa peaks when she discovers he has booked a date for James Henry's christening without consulting her

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Bert struggles to come up with the money to repay loan sharks Alastair and Norman Tonken, who gave him £1,000 to clear his debts. Eleanor falls ill and Martin diagnoses a strangulated hernia, but when the ambulance goes to the wrong village, he has no alternative but to perform the emergency operation himself in his surgery. With Martin Clunes, Ian McNeice and Louise Jameson

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: A series of scandals makes for an interesting few days in the quiet village of St Mary Mead, and most seem to revolve around a blustering local colonel, whose brusque manner and short temper make him unpopular with his fellow villagers. When he is found dead with a bullet through the head, Miss Marple and the reluctant DI Slack investigate. Whodunit, starring Geraldine McEwan as Miss Marple, with Jane Asher, Jason Flemying, Derek Jacobi and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates her friend Elspeth McGillicuddy's claim to have witnessed a murder being committed on a passing train during a rail journey, but everyone is stumped by the lack of a body. Mystery, starring Geraldine McEwan, Pam Ferris, Niamh Cusack, John Hannah, Amanda Holden, Griff Rhys Jones, David Warner, Jenny Agutter and Rob Brydon

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: An unusual message appears in Chipping Cleghorn's local newspaper, revealing details of a forthcoming murder and, while at first glance it looks like a practical joke, the information proves to be deadly accurate. Miss Marple helps Inspector Craddock with his investigation and the pair soon uncover several likely suspects in the village. Feature-length drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Zoe Wanamaker, Elaine Paige, Virginia McKenna, Cherie Lunghi and Frances Barber

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: When a respectable GP is found dead in a public lavatory, the young Morse's outlandish theories see him relegated to general duties by the newly arrived Chief Superintendent Bright. Humiliated and humbled, Endeavour has to investigate from the sidelines, but it's not long before he's questioning DI Fred Thursday's orders and risking his career to avert a family tragedy. Shaun Evans stars, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell return to tell incredible stories of people desperate to find missing family and answer questions that have haunted entire lives. This week features two stories of children searching for their birth mothers after life-changing events - former Scotland footballer Dominic Matteo, who started to search after suffering a life-threatening brain tumour, and a woman, pained with emotion on her wedding day because her birth mother was missing

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The last run of the detective drama ended with Lewis (Kevin Whately) starting a new life away from the force, but it seems that peace and quiet doesn't suit him - which is just as well, as newly promoted DI Hathaway (Laurence Fox) is struggling to find a sidekick, and within just four weeks is already on to his second sergeant, DS Lizzie Maddox (Angela Griffin). So, Chief Superintendent Innocent (Rebecca Front) decides to reunite the former partners to look into the murder of a neurosurgeon, a case with potential links to the worlds of animal rights and blood sports. In the first of this two-part story, suspicion falls on glamorous widow Erica (Kara Tointon), but it turns out there are plenty of other people in the victim's inner circle who were driven by fear and loathing

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Damon thinks he has become a dingo after eating Irene's drugs, and Vera offers support and advice from the trailer park after Karen gives birth. Comedy, starring Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Irene is left holding the baby after Karen gets back to her nightclubbing routine with Lesley, and Vera moves out of the trailer park with grand-daughter Sabrina. Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid star

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Laurence embarks on another London trip, leaving his lovelorn wife Elizabeth at home. On overhearing a saucy chat between two servants, her uncontrollable jealousy prompts her to sack them both. Gordon Jackson, Nicola Pagett and Ian Ogilvy star

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of a wealthy man whose double life left him vulnerable to exploitation. Away from work, Rachel's recent moment of indiscretion threatens to come back to haunt her when a confused Sean takes a phone call from her one-night stand, and after Ade is pushed into living with his girlfriend on a permanent basis, Janet asks her mother to move in

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: An aristocrat goes missing, along with his collection of explicit erotic paintings - and Morse's investigation provides him with a close-up view of the upper crust's dark side. What is more, there is a further culture shock lying in wait - the prospect of working with a new female pathologist. Starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Amanda Hillwood, Patricia Hodge and Clifford Rose

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The Nelsons take action to clear their name, Kevin and Sally try to put the drama of the wedding ceremony behind them and Vik attempts to get back in Steve's good books

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: A female trainee arrives at the depot and attracts the attention of the men - until they discover she is the inspector's niece

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan buys a home brew kit and begins making his own beer - but underestimates its strength and turns up for work in no fit state to drive a bus. Comedy, starring Reg Varney

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny oversees an animal translocation for his first big project as state vet, but Alice struggles to run the clinic in his absence and has a close encounter with lions. Meanwhile, Du Plessis' attempt to show Caroline the 'real Africa' backfires when he takes her on a no-frills camping trip in the wilderness. Stephen Tompkinson, Dawn Steele, Deon Stewardson and Hayley Mills star

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: When strange events occur at Leopard's Den - a mirror cracks seemingly for no reason, elephants and lions are spotted miles away from their normal habitat, and crocodiles are found dead - Danny and Alice must work fast to solve the mystery before more animals die. Meanwhile, Du Plessis discovers a pregnancy test while tidying up, but jumps to the wrong conclusion

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sian Horrocks is assaulted on her way home from work and tells Mike it was a local man who did the deed - but Jackie suspects there is more to the case than meets the eye. Elsewhere, Greengrass dreams up a scheme to fleece punters with a new investment. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr, Fiona Dolman and Samia Smith

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A fire at the home of a talented artist leads to suspicions of an arson attack, and the resultant police investigation exposes the man's patron as a likely suspect. Greengrass has limited success running a B&B, and Andy tells landlady Gina he has got to make a business trip to Scotland, filling Blaketon with misgivings. Joe McGann guest stars, with Jason Durr, Bill Maynard and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: The enormity of Terry's condition and his devastating prognosis hit Dawn for six. Robert grows increasingly edgy as Elaine grapples with her confusing flashback

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sam forces Zak and Lisa to face up to their feelings, while Cain takes Debbie for a birthday drink - much to Louise's consternation

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: As the factory girls let their hair down at their Christmas party, Karen shows Joe just how grateful she is for being given time off work at such short notice

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Dev hits the roof when he finds out Vik has gone on holiday with Steve and Karen. Tommy pays a high price for guarding the family secret

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: Sam and Foyle are shot at and almost run over by a speeding vehicle, and discover the incident is part of an illicit fuel racket. An undercover investigation reveals the detective's son Andrew to be involved, and the discovery that a driver at the petrol company has been murdered complicates matters further. Wartime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, Honeysuckle Weeks and Julian Ovenden

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie fights for justice on behalf of a trespasser shot on Lord Ashfordly's land, and Greengrass uses his new job as a newspaper columnist to criticise assorted pillars of society. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, Fiona Dolman and Rupert Vansittart.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A handsome new locum wins Maggie's heart but soon falls out of favour with the locals when a misdiagnosis results in tragedy. A display of courage by Andy reconciles him with Gina, and Greengrass's bike hire business turns out to be seriously flawed _ much to Ventress's discomfort. Rural drama, starring Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse meets his intellectual match when a serial killer haunting the streets of Oxford keeps himself one step ahead of the law and leaves cryptic messages to goad the police. At first glance, it seems to be the work of a deranged lunatic, but the elaborate staging of the crimes suggests method in the madness - and a macabre sharing of the sleuth's passion for opera. Starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Psychologist Tony Hill investigates what appears to be the honour killing of a Kurdish woman. However, the site where the body was found yields remains of other victims and an even more gruesome motive for the crimes. New colleague Chris Collins seems reluctant to pull his weight when a middle-aged teacher of his acquaintance is added to a growing list of the dead. Robson Green and Cristian Solimeno star in the thriller based on the novels by Val McDermid

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro

programme.desc: Sara Damergi goes house-hunting in Oliva, in Spain's Valencia region, hoping to find a suitable holiday home for keen cyclists Debbie and Graham from Portsmouth

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: A family from Manchester transform a hamlet in France. Meanwhile, a young couple fall in love with an earthquake-damaged Italian borgo, and a couple of B&B owners in the Pyrenees buy a ramshackle holiday village built by the Catholic church in the 1930s

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family goes away to Marge's favourite childhood holiday destination, which has unfortunately changed since she was last there. Homer spurs the locals into sprucing the place up, but an exuberant firework display wrecks everything, forcing him to make amends by becoming a fisherman

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: At the youth centre, Felix is on the receiving end of a warning. Meanwhile, the walls start to close in on Charlie when he finds himself under ever more pressure

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Graham and Sarah turn their attention to the garden, as they set out to turn Graham's picture of what he hopes the view from their kitchen may eventually look like into a reality. They go on the hunt for trees and shrubs that would improve the backdrop to their lake, restore an old bridge over a stream near their pond, and finish off the wall around the new terrace area

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: The air ambulance is dispatched to two serious road traffic collisions, while on the west bank of Loch Lomond, a minibus carrying 15 tourists has collided with a car. In South Ayrshire, an 86-year-old grandmother is struggling to breathe after a high-speed crash, and 72-year-old William has a severe cut to his arm after an attempt to chop wood with a circular saw went horrifically wrong

programme.title: Depp v Heard
programme.desc: As hostility to Amber Heard grows on social media, the trial reaches one of its most violent and disturbing moments. A violent confrontation between Depp and Heard as they visit Australia results in Depp losing part of his finger with Heard making a shocking allegation

programme.title: My Name Is Reeva
programme.desc: Documentary about Reeva Steenkamp, who was brutally murdered by her Paralympian boyfriend Oscar Pistorius on Valentine's Day 2013. In the first episode, Reeva's parents Barry and June Steenkamp discuss her early life as they face fresh grief from the news that a parole process will put them in contact with Pistorius

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. At this stage of the competition, it's no surprise that people find retrieving pineapples from a millpond stressful. The comics inventively repurpose umbrellas and - in a fitting climax - Frankie goes to town on a gigantic cat scratching post. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A man involved in a car crash needs to be carefully removed from his vehicle to protect his spine. It's also a day when everyday errands go badly wrong. A slip on fallen crab apples in the street leaves a woman in agony with a suspected broken hip. An afternoon spent pottering in the garden ends with a fall headfirst into a brick wall. A bicycle leaves a young man with a swollen kneecap that paramedics suspect is broken, while picking up a prescription from the chemist ends with a collapse and a trip to hospital

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the restaurants he tried to save, returning to Lido, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro to find out whether his advice has been put to good use

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Joe Lycett explores how to get the most out of a weekend away with a fun-packed, 48-hour itinerary of trademark humour and facts. This time, fellow comedian Sarah Millican joins him for an exploration of the Lithuanian capital Vilnius. The duo take to the skies to see the city from above - an experience they find by turns terrifying, thrilling and beautiful. Keen to explore Lithuanian cuisine, they sample cold beetroot soup and cepelini dumplings washed down with gira, a drink made from fermented beer. Later, the pair explore Vilnius' medieval centre on foot, taking in Gediminas's tower and Lukiskes Prison

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows interior designer Kathryn Tyler as she tries to create a Scandinavian-style eco house in her mother's back garden in Falmouth, Cornwall, close by the Lizard Peninsula. The plan is ambitious, featuring a white-painted brick ground floor, a lightweight timber-frame first floor and cleverly designed spaces, but the small size of the plot and Kathryn's inexperience could hamper the project

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Collie cross puppy Joey is a popular dog around the kennels, and has been a reliable buddy for the anxious dogs - but will he prove the same support to Holly, Adam and their son Oscar? Toy poodle Gizmo tries to overcome his social anxieties to win the hearts of Fiona and Maisie, a mother and daughter coming to terms with their future separation, and a lurcher with a broken tail requires lots of care - and with any luck, a forever home

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: In one of the fastest pursuits in interceptor history, units mobilise to try to stop a 185mph superbike that is pulling wheelies, giving stinger teams the run-around, and even testing the flying skills of the National Police Air Support Unit. With the lives of other motorists at risk, the last resort is authority for tactical contact between cop car and the motorbike, but can advanced driver Paul Charlesworth pull it off?

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc: Detectives investigate when a man is found in the early hours badly beaten at the side of the road with significant facial injuries and little recollection of what happened. DS Lee Marriner and DC Craig Weir start hunting through all the images from that night to see if they can pick up anyone who might have been with the victim, and several clips emerge but identification is a problem

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: Documentary following Gloucestershire Constabulary on the night shift, with a busy Saturday for PC Hewer on patrol in Cheltenham town centre. Among the crowds of drinkers, Hewer challenges a man suspected of urinating in the street, who then becomes abusive

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: A man is rushed in with some of the worst facial injuries the team have ever seen, a woman has been badly injured in a road accident, and another has fallen in a care home

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The firearms team mobilises to tackle a suspect armed with a pistol, and hours into a nerve-shredding siege, the man emerges with a handgun and fires. Elsewhere, interceptors Rob and Dan join in the pursuit of a runaway hatchback, while the members of the knife crime team track down a suspect on a bike trying to evade capture in a park

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Walking Britain's Lost Railways
programme.desc: Until it closed in 1966 the Deeside Railway followed the River Dee upstream from Aberdeen into what is now the Cairngorms National Park. As luck would have it, Queen Victoria purchased Balmoral just as the line was set to open, giving the route prestige. Rob Bell retraces the route, visiting a shooting estate, tossing a caber and finding an unmistakable Highland 'brand' that all owe their existence to this royal railway age. He also explores a quiet valley of cattle farming and timber sawmills, and, in truth, a simple railway that struggled for decades to justify its own existence, despite its royal veneer

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: There are a few unwelcome surprises for patient Stephen when he arrives to see Dr Ajay Singal about the stomach pains he has been experiencing following a recent spot of gardening. Katie sees nurse Claire Hentrich to discuss her prolonged periods, and Dr Jo Tatlock meets Annette, who has been struggling with pains and lumps in her fingers - jeopardising her work as a woodwind musician

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton look back over highlights from the series. A two-bedroom semi in the Black Country made quite an impression, thanks to the unmistakable smell of dogs and a large collection of dolls, as did a cottage in Northamptonshire that seemed to have four sitting rooms

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: Monkey explores a Roman amphitheatre with a historian and discovers what it was used for. Plus, the Milkshakers make Roman shields

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Pip devises an adventure quest for him and Posy

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Gordon has a tantrum about all the changes being made to the railway, but his new friend Na helps him see them in a different light

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her family visit a new theme park, where there is a lot of fun to be had with vegetables

programme.title: Barnyard (2006)
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Tooth Fairy (2010)
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: Men in Black 3 Interview Special
programme.desc: Will Smith discusses returning to the role of Agent J for the third film in the sci-fi comedy series, and director Barry Sonnenfeld speaks about his role behind the camera on the three movies. Newcomer Josh Brolin shares his thoughts on filling Tommy Lee Jones' shoes as a younger version of veteran alien-catcher Agent K

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2014)
programme.desc: A reporter discovers four humanoid amphibians who live in the sewers of New York, and use their martial arts skills to fight crime. She helps them as they face their toughest challenge yet - defeating a sinister criminal organisation that seems to have power over the entire city. Fantasy adventure, starring Megan Fox and William Fichtner, with the voice of Johnny Knoxville

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows (2016)
programme.desc: The sewer-dwelling heroes discover their arch enemy Shredder has returned from another dimension, and made a deal with an alien warlord. Assisted by two mutant henchman, Shredder goes in search of a lost device that will allow his new ally to mount an invasion of Earth. Action adventure sequel, starring Megan Fox, Will Arnett and Stephen Amell

programme.title: Daddy's Home (2015)
programme.desc: A mild-mannered man hopes for his wife's two children to view him as their father. His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg

programme.title: Upgrade (2018)
programme.desc: Technophobe Grey Trace is left confined to a wheelchair after being mugged. His only hope for revenge is Stem, an experimental computer chip implant that allows him to control his body. However, once implanted, Stem starts talking to Trace and takes over his body. Sci-fi thriller, starring Logan Marshall-Green and Melanie Vallejo

programme.title: Dune (1984)
programme.desc: A far-flung galactic empire is sustained by a priceless mind-expanding spice found only on a desolate desert world. Rival factions seeking to take over production plunge the planet into war, while the native people await the coming of a prophesied saviour who will lead them to freedom. David Lynch's sci-fi fantasy based on Frank Herbert's novel, starring Kyle MacLachlan, Francesca Annis, Sting, Patrick Stewart and Kenneth McMillan

programme.title: The Columnist (2019)
programme.desc: Successful columnist Femke is flooded every day by anonymous harassments and death threats on social media. She becomes addicted to the vicious messages, and finds herself continuously clicking back to the hateful comments before she goes to sleep. Not only is this affecting her motivation to write new articles, but she also needs to finish writing the novel she promised to deliver her publisher. One day, she snaps - but the act of violence and revenge inspires her to write like never before. Comic thriller, starring Katja Herbers. In Dutch

programme.title: Tad the Lost Explorer and the Secret of King Midas (2017)
programme.desc: Awkward explorer Tad Jones must rescue his beloved Sara from a millionaire who is looking for King Midas' necklace. Animated adventure, with the voices of Michelle Jenner, Adriana Ugarte and Oscar Barberan

programme.title: The Perfect Catch (2005)
programme.desc: Unlikely couple Ben and Lindsey meet and fall in love over the winter. When summer brings a new baseball season, Lindsey discovers Ben's devotion to the Boston Red Sox baseball team knows no bounds - and suspects she will always come second. The Farrelly brothers' romantic comedy, starring Jimmy Fallon and Drew Barrymore, inspired by Nick Hornby's football-themed novel Fever Pitch, but with America's favourite sport replacing Britain's

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada (2006)
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: Daddy's Home 2 (2017)
programme.desc: Having settled their differences, Brad and Dusty's newfound friendship is put to the test when their respective fathers - one gentle, the other overly macho - arrive for the Christmas holidays, forcing them to change their plans. What starts as a break at a fun-filled trip to a luxury resort turns into something far more chaotic. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Mel Gibson and John Lithgow

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears (2002)
programme.desc: The CIA becomes suspicious of Russia's nuclear activities, and agent Jack Ryan is ordered to investigate. However, it is not long before the threat of terrorists detonating a nuclear bomb on American soil is on the cards, sparking a race against the clock to avert disaster. Thriller based on Tom Clancy's novel, starring Ben Affleck, Morgan Freeman, James Cromwell, Liev Schreiber, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Bates

programme.title: Another 48 Hrs (1990)
programme.desc: Tough cop Jack Cates sets out on the trail of a mysterious drug kingpin, but finds an unexpected lead when he learns his enemy has put a price on the head of wisecracking convict Reggie Hammond - forcing the pair to join forces once again. Comedy thriller sequel, starring Eddie Murphy, Nick Nolte, Brion James, Kevin Tighe and Ed O'Ross

programme.title: Loveless (2017)
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Alyosha overhears his parents bitterly arguing about who should take him when they divorce, and soon after he goes missing. However, the police make such a poor effort to find Alyosha that it falls to a team of benevolent volunteers to look for the missing boy. Drama, starring Aleksey Rozin, Maryana Spivak and Matvey Novikov. In Russian and Tajik

programme.title: Getting Personal
programme.desc: Getting Personal is an interview programme in which presenter Deepa Shastri meets Richard D France, a poet, writer and a mental health campaigner

programme.title: Hatari! (1962)
programme.desc: A group of reckless animal trappers travels through the wilds of Africa, but the arrival of a beautiful photographer looks set to cause upheaval among the group. Comedy adventure, starring John Wayne, Red Buttons, Hardy Kruger, Elsa Martinelli and Michele Girardon

programme.title: Comanche Station (1960)
programme.desc: A cowboy recruits a trio of outlaws to rescue a woman held captive at a Comanche camp and reunite her with her husband in return for a large reward. However, his partners decide the bounty should be split three ways rather than four and plan to double-cross him. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Nancy Gates, Claude Akins and Skip Homeier

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora! (1970)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama recounting the bombing of Pearl Harbour from both the Japanese and American perspectives, reconstructing the events leading up to the devastating attack on the US naval base in 1941. Starring Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotten, James Whitmore and Jason Robards

programme.title: Star Trek (2009)
programme.desc: The trainee crew members of the starship Enterprise embark on their maiden flight, which pits them against a Romulan commander from the future who is planning a horrific revenge on those he blames for a tragedy in his own time. Sci-fi adventure based on the original TV series, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Eric Bana, Zoe Saldana and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Independence Day (1996)
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerich's sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr

programme.title: The Craft (1996)
programme.desc: A new girl who finds it difficult to fit in at school befriends three goth misfits, who discover they can perform magic and form a secret coven. They initially use their powers for self-improvement, but eventually start to turn against their classmates, driving the ringleader insane as her lust for power takes over. Horror, starring Robin Tunney, Fairuza Balk, Neve Campbell, Rachel True and Skeet Ulrich

programme.title: Book Club (2018)
programme.desc: Four lifelong friends aim to spice up their mundane routines by reading the provocative bestseller Fifty Shades of Grey in their monthly book club. With newfound confidence, they each begin to come alive as exciting romances are ignited and old flames are rekindled. Comedy drama, starring Diane Keaton and Jane Fonda

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam make a big decision, Phil and Claire try to squeeze in some time alone, while Jay and Gloria prepare for Manny's solo trip to Colombia to visit relatives

programme.title: Lego Masters
programme.desc: Melvin Odoom invites the seven remaining teams to take part in the 'Drop Test'. Using 1,000 bricks, the teams must create a structure that when dropped from height will smash to pieces. The further the spread of broken bricks, the higher the score. Next, the teams construct a scene from history. From the Ice Age to Ancient Egypt to 1950s America, which historical scene will the jury like the best, and which team will leave the contest? Matthew Ashton and Fran Scott are joined on judging duty by comedian Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Tom plans a wedding at his favourite theme park, but his down-to-earth fiancee Becca has always dreamed of being treated like a princess on her special day

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Ollie and Gareth introduce Liv to their surrogate, Willow is unfazed by Imogen's revelations about Harvey, and Reza and Sam at each other's throats

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dinner reservations have been secured at a plush restaurant, but Gloria is taking forever to get ready and an almighty sartorial crisis strikes when Mitch and Cam don the exact same outfit. Meanwhile, the Dunphys can't decide whether Luke is trustworthy enough to be left home alone. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny is not happy when Gloria hires a male nanny and it turns out Jay isn't that keen either. Phil is worried about his dad Frank, and embarks on a mission to help him get his groove back, while Pepper pops by to plan Mitch and Cam's wedding, but when talk turns to unicorns, the pair attempt to rein their pal in. Nathan Lane guest stars

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A family trip to the school fair proves eventful for Phil and Claire, while Haley's relaxing day by the pool is interrupted by an awkward encounter with 'manny' Andy and Jay is unimpressed when Gloria signs him up for 'cop duties'

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire head to ClosetCon'13, a trade show for the closet industry, providing the perfect opportunity for Phil to find out what his father-in-law is storing in his secret room. Cam takes Lily and Mitch to the Tucker family farm, though he does not bargain on a visit from Grams (guest star Ann Guilbert), who is known for her homophobia. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is determined to lead the Dolphins to victory in a big football game, showing no mercy to the opposition despite the fact they are playing with an unexpected disadvantage. Off the field, Phil tries to teach his kids about optimism, but nothing seems to be going his way. Meanwhile, at Pritchett Closets & Blinds, Claire is desperate to prove to her colleagues that she is more than just the boss's daughter. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Matt Lucas presents as four more famous faces put their baking skills to the test for charity. Hollywood star James McAvoy, singer and Voice coach Anne-Marie, writer and comedian David Baddiel and former athlete Kelly Holmes are this week's quartet, whose challenges involve decorative tarts, a savoury technical and rendering animals in cake form

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II (1986)
programme.desc: High-kicking teenager Daniel accompanies his venerable mentor Mr Miyagi when he returns to the Japanese province of Okinawa to visit his dying father. However, an old rival of Miyagi's is waiting for them, while Daniel is drawn into a vicious conflict with their enemy's own karate protege. Martial arts sequel, starring Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita and Yuji Okumoto

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog (2020)
programme.desc: Sonic, a blue hedgehog who can run at supersonic speeds, is transported to Earth. A decade later, while enjoying life in Montana, his speedy skills create an electromagnetic pulse. Scientific genius Dr Robotnik is hired to investigate, and becomes obsessed with capturing the creature for his power. Live-action fantasy adventure based on the video games, starring James Marsden and Jim Carrey, with the voice of Ben Schwartz

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon receive an invitation to present their research to a physics conference, but Sheldon's reluctance to pander to his peers causes conflict between the friends. An intervention by Penny makes matters worse. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Leonard invent excuses to avoid having to attend Penny's performance in a production of the stage musical Rent, but maintaining the pretence makes matters increasingly complicated. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with DJ Qualls

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette's friends each try different tactics to help her go into labour. Howard isn't happy when he finds out that Bernadette has already chosen their son's name without his input

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While Leonard jumps through hoops to help secure the perfect wedding venue for Sheldon and Amy, Howard and Bernadette have a difficult time deciding which one of them should stay at home with the kids and who should return to work

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets the opportunity to spend time with Bill Gates at work, because his business wants to partner with her pharmaceutical company. Leonard, Howard and Raj do everything in their power to also meet the high-tech entrepreneur, while Sheldon thinks he's the victim of an April Fool's Day prank

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard runs against Sheldon to be president of the tenants' association, while Bernadette encourages Howard and Raj to track down the owner of a drone they find in the back garden

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The first of two specials paying tribute to the winners from past shows, made to celebrate the series' 10th anniversary. The first programme focuses on the winners from the first five series, reliving their most memorable moments, from their first Signature challenge to their final Showstopper

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A mix of series favourites and some of Britain's best-loved LGBTQ+ personalities - including Rylan and his mother Linda, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Scott Mills and Sam Ryder, Duncan James and Denise van Outen, Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, and Paul Sinha and his husband Oliver - take to their sofas, ready to share their views with the nation for a very special Pride anniversary episode

programme.title: Gogglebox

Celebrity Special, Celebrity Antiques Road Trip, Strictly Come Dancing, The Lakes with Simon Reeve, Sex Unzipped, and This Morning. Narrated by Craig Cash

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, Tiger King 2, An Audience with Adele, Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Close to Me, Inside Beverly Hills: The Land of the Rich and Famous, BBC/ITV News (Austria) and Newsnight (The PM)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A cheating ex has left 26-year-old personal trainer Kriss with trust issues and a desire to find a lasting relationship is matched with 18-year-old beauty therapist Ruby, who has a habit of dating bad boys. Retired secretary and all-round lover-of-life Patricia is embarking on a bucket year, which includes a search for a new partner, and she goes on a date with octogenarian Alan, a self-confessed flirt who runs a tennis club

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Teacher and self-confessed cougar Marie returns to the restaurant for a date with 32-year-old lighting technician Adrian, while sports enthusiast Stephanie is matched with former rugby player Stuart. Plus, 71-year-old Janet and 87-year-old former soldier George bond over their shared love of travel and even joke about jetting off to Venezuela together

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
