programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: The team investigates an ingeniously converted petrol tanker involved in an accident, with an interior decked out like the cabin of a yacht

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels from Newcastle to Edinburgh by high speed train. Along the way, she stops off at the coastal town of Alnmouth, discovers where the phrase Keep Calm and Carry On originated, visits the world's biggest gannet colony, and goes out to sea with a lobster breeder. When she reaches her destination, she discovers the connection between the railway and the famous Balmoral Hotel

programme.title: Rudyard Kipling: A Secret Life
programme.desc: A profile of the author, which looks at how the writer's childhood and the loss of two of his three children influenced his work

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: How the Stauffenberg bomb missed Hitler by inches. Documentary investigating how the German leader managed to escape assassination several times thanks to his handpicked bodyguards

programme.title: Time Limit (1957)
programme.desc: A soldier held as a POW during the Korean War confesses to having assisted the enemy during his imprisonment. His superior officers are determined to see him face a court martial as soon as possible, but the investigator assigned to the case suspects he is an innocent man incriminating himself to hide something. Korean War drama, with Richard Widmark and Richard Basehart

programme.title: The World of Henry Orient (1964)
programme.desc: Two wealthy teenage girls idolise a womanising pianist and follow him around New York, thwarting his efforts to seduce a married woman. Slapstick comedy, with Peter Sellers, Tippy Walker, Merrie Spaeth and Tom Bosley

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: A journey through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White takes you to Thameside, Chiswick and Strand on the Green, to explore the wonderful world of Mudlarking, with local historian Liz Anderson

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels on the famous Great Western Railway to Cornwall. She recalls childhood holidays when she stops at Torquay before heading to a supposedly haunted castle at Kingswear. She also uncovers tales of smuggling and joins members of the RNLI on a practice run before visiting an unusual cake shop in Penzance

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Survivors recall a routine flight from London Heathrow to Belfast International Airport that ended in tragedy when British Midland Flight 92 crashed onto a motorway embankment near the town of Kegworth on 8th January 1989

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Emotions run high as the friends are united in grief at a funeral, leading to a bitter row that causes a huge rift in the group. Several months pass without a word between the women, before a heartbreaking announcement finally brings them back together. An unexpected guest at Siobhan's birthday party forces her to question her new relationship, while Trudi is panic-stricken when Amy goes missing. Final episode of the drama, starring Orla Brady and Sharon Small

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: John Thaw stars in David Hare's political drama based on his stage play about a Labour MP who finds himself campaigning against his own party

programme.title: Doorways (2015)
programme.desc: An insecure student takes a job as a bouncer to prove his masculinity, and is taken under the wing of a hardened veteran of the job. As he learns the tricks of the trade, he is drawn on a dangerous journey with murderous consequences that will teach him there is more than one way to be a real man. Drama, starring Steven Murphy and Jonathan Ciardini

programme.title: Lips of Blood (1975)
programme.desc: A man's strange dreams about a beautiful woman and a crumbling mansion begin to obsess him - leading him into the bizarre world inhabited by the living dead, where the lines between fantasy and reality are blurred. Erotic horror, starring Jean-Lou Philippe and Paul Bisciglia

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the nutrient-rich waters around the Isle of Mull in the Inner Hebrides. There, he goes whale watching with local skipper James Fairburns, and comes face to face with the world's second-largest fish. Back on dry land, he observes an otter hunting along the coast, and meets David Sexton - the island's RSPB officer - to examine a white-tailed eagle nesting site

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh and Jono rent a motorhome and head to the magnificent Flinders Ranges where Poh creates incredibly delicious food on a camp stove

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: After making a Malaysian sweet treat known as 'love letters' for Sara's mum, Poh cooks up her favourite brownie recipe

programme.title: The Courtneys of Curzon Street (1947)
programme.desc: An aristocrat scandalously marries his mother's maid, and their family endures a series of crises over the next four generations. Period drama, with Anna Neagle and Michael Wilding

programme.title: Frankie and Johnny (1966)
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck gambler working as an entertainer on a Mississippi riverboat finds his fortunes changing when he meets a red-headed woman who brings him good luck, much to the dismay of his jealous girlfriend. Musical drama, starring Elvis Presley, Donna Douglas, Harry Morgan and Nancy Kovack

programme.title: Tomorrow is Forever (1946)
programme.desc: A man returns from the First World War horribly scarred, and allows his wife and child to believe he has been killed in action rather than revealing his disfigurement. Drama, starring Claudette Colbert, Orson Welles, George Brent, Lucile Watson, Richard Long and Natalie Wood

programme.title: The Fake (1953)
programme.desc: An American detective tries to trace the theft of a priceless Leonardo painting from the Tate Gallery. Crime drama, starring Dennis O'Keefe and Coleen Gray

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: An interstellar slave trader lands on Alpha demanding Maya as payment for a device that could take Koenig's people back to Earth. Willoughby Goddard guest stars

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: Love is in the air with regulars Martin and Jennifer, Animal communicator Lyn Furlong visits a horse sanctuary, and at the Nuthouse Hen Sanctuary in Co Down, there's a report on a woman who has changed her name to Mama Hen

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the ancient forests of the Isle of Wight, revealing why the island provides the perfect sanctuary for endangered red squirrels to breed and prosper, and how the absence of deer has allowed small mammals to flourish in deciduous woodland. He joins Ian White of the People's Trust for Endangered Species as he goes on his rounds, checking nest boxes designed to preserve the dormouse, and finds out about one of Britain's rarest amphibians - the great crested newt

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: John Thaw stars in David Hare's political drama based on his stage play about a Labour MP who finds himself campaigning against his own party

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. The pair meet in London in the 1920s and, despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspired one of Virginia's novels. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini

programme.title: Hidden Agenda (1990)
programme.desc: A CID inspector visits Northern Ireland to investigate the murder of an American lawyer and human rights activist. Political thriller, starring Brian Cox, Brad Dourif, Frances McDormand and Mai Zetterling

programme.desc: Tripitaka is visited by the dead King of Cockcrow in a dream, who tells him he was murdered by a Taoist magician who has been impersonating him for years - so the priest resolves to expose the killer

programme.title: Against the Wind (1948)
programme.desc: A Belgian priest living in exile in Britain during the Second World War becomes a secret agent for the Allies, but his first mission is a disaster, leading to the capture of a resistance leader. Four soldiers are sent into occupied France to rescue the insurgent, but begin to realise they have a traitor in their midst. Thriller, starring Jack Warner and Simone Signoret

programme.title: Payroll (1961)
programme.desc: The widow of an armoured car driver swears revenge on the criminals who killed him - leading them to turn on each other. Crime drama, staring Michael Craig and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: Poh & Co

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh joins Andre on a food adventure sourcing some of South Australia's finest produce. Back home, Poh creates two brilliant new recipes - the ultimate beef pie and coffee éclairs

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part one of a two part documentary exploring the struggle for Irish independence in the early 20th century. Professor Eunan O'Halpin examines the years leading up to the 1918 British general election, which saw a rise in radicalisation among both Nationalists and Unionists

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola and Olly lock themselves away in a hotel room to try to finish preparing an important speech for the annual party conference. However, it is Glenn who hits the spot when he enlists the help of a local people's champion with a tragic tale. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Chris Addison

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion

programme.title: Regina: The First Woman Rabbi
programme.desc: Documentary about Regina Jonas, who made history when she became the first officially ordained female rabbi in 1935. Through personal correspondence and newspaper articles she left behind, this film tells her story, from her upbringing in Berlin as the daughter of an Orthodox Jewish peddler, through her studies to her ordination. Featuring Rachel Weisz as the voice of Regina

programme.desc: A priest ventures deep into the Amazon to set up a mission, and has a son with a mysterious woman. When both are killed, the boy ventures out of the jungle and travels to a city, where he is taken in by his father's kindly mentor - but the youth struggles to adapt to modern living. Drama, starring Alessandro Rabelo and Charles Durning
